programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Newlyweds Karen and John Leonard from Essex are on the brink of retirement. With the last of the six boys they have between them about to leave home, theyre looking for a new adventure and a complete change of lifestyle in the south of Gran Canaria.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Simon White and friend and neighbour Shirley Boyle are first to host at The Old Hall Country House in the picturesque village of Madeley in Cheshire. On arrival most of the guests are awed by the historical 16th century BandB. In the afternoon, Simon and Shirley take their guests tap dancing and in keeping with the five-star luxury to a private fine dining restaurant for dinner.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Its day two in the competition and the turn of cat-lover Eileen Finn to cater for her BandB competitors at the four-star Thornley House in Allendale, Northumbria. After being blown away by first hosts Simon and Shirley at the luxury Old Hall Country House, Eileen has her work cut out. Also, Eileens beloved and very large Maine Coon cats are not to all of her guests liking.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jessica and Adrian Rashleigh are third to host at their three bedroom establishment Chy Conyn in St Ives, on the beautiful Cornish coast. The hosts hope that what they lack for in size they will make up for in stunning surroundings. For the activity Jessica and Adrian take their guests on a magical mystery camper van tour of the local sights. At breakfast some of the guests struggle with the small breakfast room.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final hosts are Tim and Karen from The Cavendish in Bournemouth. The guests are initially impressed with the 16-bed `pink palace, but things go downhill when Simon and Shirley vigorously test their bed - and break it. Jessica and Adrian are worried that their room, situated right next to the front door, may mean a noisy night. Eileen however is delighted by the feline memorabilia left in her room as a special touch.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals reconvene for one last time to find out how much theyve been paid by their fellow BandB owners, and to sort out their differences. Simon White of Old Hall Country House is stunned by a generous overpayment, but Eileen Finn from the four-star Thornley is on the receiving end of some harsh criticism and some even harsher payments, and a shock underpayment leaves Tim from The Cavendish in Bournemouth reeling.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Southend-on-Sea, the first to host is dog-fancier executive PA Julie-Ann Rayner. Julie-Anns a dinner party veteran and has high hopes that her `taste of the Sea menu - with not one, but two fish courses - will have her guests hooked, assuming that they all like fish, that is. If her fishy feast doesnt go down a treat, Julie-Ann has some musical mayhem up her sleeve.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its grandmother Carols turn to host in Southend-on-Sea. Shes pretty confident in the kitchen, and her menu includes scallops and roast lamb.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its night three of the competition in Southend, where science teacher and self confessed geek Damian Loneragan is hosting.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its the penultimate night of the competition in Southend and all eyes are on barmaid and self confessed airhead Steph Barrett as she hosts a dinner party in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize. The day gets off to a disastrous start as Steph attempts to make pastry for the very first time with hilarious results. Things get back on track after an emergency visit from her Nan who brings round some ready-made pastry.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its the last night of the competition and the turn of DJ Scott Langley to host a dinner party in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize. Scotts a pretty good cook and is soon flying ahead with his cooking, but hes taken a massive gamble.

programme.title: WA World Championship Athletics LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage continues of the first evening session of the 2025 World Athletics Championships as three gold medals are handed out. programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Cornwall, the call of the sea and Steve Brown beckon a young, water-loving couple who are looking to escape to the coastal county with their young daughter. They have £620,000 to spend on their new Cornish home. Steve also gets the chance to take to the water with a sailing school who support people of all abilities to develop their nautical know-how.

Then, the fastest man and woman in the world will be crowned, with the finals of the 100m finishing off the second days action.

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: An intimacy crate washes up to help the honeymooners get personal. And when the couples spend the day apart at beach picnics, some are left reeling from shocking revelations, before a brand-new couple jump into stranded life together.

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise

programme.title: WA World Championship Athletics LIVE
programme.desc: The first medals on the track and in the field are handed out at the National Stadium in Tokyo as day one of the World Athletics Championships reaches its conclusion. programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Join Alex Scott and guests to kick off your footballing weekend. We preview the Premier League action, including the Manchester derby, and discuss issues around the game, with detailed analysis from an expert panel.

programme.title: Womens Rugby World Cup LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage of the first quarter-final of the Womens Rugby World Cup 2025.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King continue their culinary journey through time, celebrating British Food. Here, the duo explore the incredible influence the Monarchy has had over the food we eat, past and present. Dave and Si create a modern version of the classic Coronation Chicken and create a sumptuous beef dish named after Prince Albert. They also meet food historian Ivan Day and recreate dishes from the coronati.

programme.title: Womens Rugby World Cup LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage of the second quarter-final of the Womens Rugby World Cup 2025.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The show comes from Dover Castle in Kent. Antique experts Catherine Southon and Jonathan Pratt search for items to take off to auction. Catherine falls for a colourful brooch and Jonathan unearths a horn beaker used by Winston Churchill. Paul Martin uncovers the story of Dover Castles secret tunnels.

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: The worlds greatest classical music party gets under way from the Royal Albert Hall, with soprano Louise Alder and the last ever performance from star trumpeter Alison Balsom.

programme.title: Iron Maiden: Live in Concert
programme.desc: A 60-minute concert filmed in different cities around the world in early 2008, featuring songs such as Fear of the Dark, Wasted Years, Number of the Beast and Hallowed Be Thy Name.

programme.title: Iron Maiden: Flight 666
programme.desc: The first leg of Iron Maidens Somewhere Back in Time world tour, which took them around the planet, playing 23 concerts on five continents in just 45 days.

programme.title: WA World Athletics Championships LIVE
programme.desc: Day 2 of the World Athletics Championships begins with the womens marathon, which for the first time starts and finishes in the National Stadium in Tokyo. Elsewhere, Great Britains Josh Kerr begins the defence of his 1500m world title in the heats, and the womens sprint hurdlers are also in action in qualifying.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Sammi Kinghorn trace the pawprints of a river legend - Tarka the Otter, to explore how the people of North Devon have helped the Eurasian otter claw back from near-extinction.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The BBCs Breakfast programme features the latest news, sport, business, weather and other items on a daily basis.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: At Beechgrove Garden, Lizzie and Brian return to the project of creating a new garden in memory of presenter Jim McColl, who passed away last year. Jims favourite trees, acers, are being planted.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Dave and Si explore how our love affair with bread has evolved over centuries. With their unique banter and camaraderie, they try their hand at Bagel making; create their own version of Summer Pudding and make a delicious soup and roll combo.

programme.title: WA World Championship Athletics LIVE
programme.desc: Five world champions are crowned on the second day of the World Athletics Championships from Tokyo as the fastest men and women in the world take to the track. After winning Olympic silver in Paris 2024, Matthew Hudson-Smith starts his campaign for a first world title as he lines up in the heats of the mens 400 metres. Great Britains world indoor champion Amber Anning is in action in qualifying for the womens 400m.

programme.title: Womens Rugby World Cup LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage of the third quarter-final of the Womens Rugby World Cup 2025.

programme.title: Brief Encounter
programme.desc: Housewife Laura Jesson meets Dr Alec Harvey at a railway station cafe and there is a spark. While both are married, they are tempted to adultery before they realise their marriages are more important than the fleeting happiness they may find together.

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham explores what enables birds of prey to rule the aerial roost. Their ability to dominate their fellow birds in terms of strength, manoeuvrability and speed, is down to a combination of anatomical and physiological adaptations.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Its the semi-final of the Great British Sewing Bee, and three challenges stand between the sewers and the final: plus fours, polo shirts and 1920s-inspired party outfits.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team presents from Culzean Castle on the west coast of Scotland. Experts Anita Manning and Natasha Raskin Sharp are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. A watercolour with a local connection catches Anita?s eye, while Natasha is drawn to a gorgeous handwoven blanket. Paul Martin explores a hidden part of Culzean?s history, uncovering the tales of smugglers working the coastline in the caves beneath the castle walls.

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: A frantic mother alerts the lifeguards after six teenagers are cut off by the tide. The Anstruther crew race to the rescue of a female paddleboarder. The reports of a clothed person entering the water lead the Selsey crew to a late-night search.

programme.title: Rob and Rylans Passage to India
programme.desc: In Delhi, Rob and Rylan discover a tomb with a view, encounter a billionaire art collector, attempt their own rap performance, and try the ancient art of puppetry.

programme.title: Tár
programme.desc: Renowned musician Lydia Tár is days away from recording the symphony that will elevate her career. When all elements seem to conspire against her, Lydias adopted daughter Petra becomes an integral emotional support for her struggling mother.

programme.title: International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: Highlights of the third game of the T20 series between England and South Africa.

programme.title: The Guest
programme.desc: Ria faces the police while trying to pick up the pieces with Lee. But that will mean cutting Fran off entirely. Can she ever go back to her old life?

programme.title: Here We Go
programme.desc: Paul is going to be Altas godfather, but only if he gets himself baptised first.

programme.title: Gardeners World
programme.desc: Monty is harvesting sweetcorn. Toby visits a magical garden in Wiltshire. Frances is in a Cornish village to find out how pioneering technology is creating beautiful borders for pollinators. A self-taught grower is transforming her allotment.

programme.title: WA World Championship Athletics LIVE
programme.desc: The first medals on the track and in the field are handed out at the National Stadium in Tokyo as day one of the World Athletics Championships reaches its conclusion. After missing the whole of last season through injury, Great Britains Jazmin Sawyers is in action, aiming to qualify for the womens long jump final tomorrow.

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Join Alex Scott and guests to kick off your footballing weekend. We preview the Premier League action, including the Manchester derby, and discuss issues around the game, with detailed analysis from an expert panel.

programme.title: Womens Rugby World Cup LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage of the first quarter-final of the Womens Rugby World Cup 2025.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King continue their culinary journey through time, celebrating British Food. Here, the duo explore the incredible influence the Monarchy has had over the food we eat, past and present. Dave and Si create a modern version of the classic Coronation Chicken and create a sumptuous beef dish named after Prince Albert. They also meet food historian Ivan Day and recreate dishes from the coronati.

programme.title: Womens Rugby World Cup LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage of the second quarter-final of the Womens Rugby World Cup 2025.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The show comes from Dover Castle in Kent. Antique experts Catherine Southon and Jonathan Pratt search for items to take off to auction. Catherine falls for a colourful brooch and Jonathan unearths a horn beaker used by Winston Churchill. Paul Martin uncovers the story of Dover Castles secret tunnels.

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: The worlds greatest classical music party gets under way from the Royal Albert Hall, with soprano Louise Alder and the last ever performance from star trumpeter Alison Balsom.

programme.title: Iron Maiden: Live in Concert
programme.desc: A 60-minute concert filmed in different cities around the world in early 2008, featuring songs such as Fear of the Dark, Wasted Years, Number of the Beast and Hallowed Be Thy Name.

programme.title: Iron Maiden: Flight 666
programme.desc: The first leg of Iron Maidens Somewhere Back in Time world tour, which took them around the planet, playing 23 concerts on five continents in just 45 days.

programme.title: WA World Athletics Championships LIVE
programme.desc: Day 2 of the World Athletics Championships begins with the womens marathon, which for the first time starts and finishes in the National Stadium in Tokyo. Elsewhere, Great Britains Josh Kerr begins the defence of his 1500m world title in the heats, and the womens sprint hurdlers are also in action in qualifying.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.desc: The weeks walks take place in stunning north west Wales. Four million people visit the region each year to enjoy its beautiful lakes and coastlines, as well as the challenging Snowdonia mountain range.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Sammi Kinghorn trace the pawprints of a river legend - Tarka the Otter, to explore how the people of North Devon have helped the Eurasian otter claw back from near-extinction.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The BBCs Breakfast programme features the latest news, sport, business, weather and other items on a daily basis.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: At Beechgrove Garden, Lizzie and Brian return to the project of creating a new garden in memory of presenter Jim McColl, who passed away last year. Jims favourite trees, acers, are being planted.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Dave and Si explore how our love affair with bread has evolved over centuries. With their unique banter and camaraderie, they try their hand at Bagel making; create their own version of Summer Pudding and make a delicious soup and roll combo.

programme.title: WA World Championship Athletics LIVE
programme.desc: Five world champions are crowned on the second day of the World Athletics Championships from Tokyo as the fastest men and women in the world take to the track. After winning Olympic silver in Paris 2024, Matthew Hudson-Smith starts his campaign for a first world title as he lines up in the heats of the mens 400 metres. Great Britains world indoor champion Amber Anning is in action in qualifying for the womens 400m.

programme.title: Womens Rugby World Cup LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage of the third quarter-final of the Womens Rugby World Cup 2025.

programme.title: Brief Encounter
programme.desc: Housewife Laura Jesson meets Dr Alec Harvey at a railway station cafe and there is a spark. While both are married, they are tempted to adultery before they realise their marriages are more important than the fleeting happiness they may find together.

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham explores what enables birds of prey to rule the aerial roost. Their ability to dominate their fellow birds in terms of strength, manoeuvrability and speed, is down to a combination of anatomical and physiological adaptations.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Its the semi-final of the Great British Sewing Bee, and three challenges stand between the sewers and the final: plus fours, polo shirts and 1920s-inspired party outfits.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team presents from Culzean Castle on the west coast of Scotland. Experts Anita Manning and Natasha Raskin Sharp are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. A watercolour with a local connection catches Anita?s eye, while Natasha is drawn to a gorgeous handwoven blanket. Paul Martin explores a hidden part of Culzean?s history, uncovering the tales of smugglers working the coastline in the caves beneath the castle walls.

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: A frantic mother alerts the lifeguards after six teenagers are cut off by the tide. The Anstruther crew race to the rescue of a female paddleboarder. The reports of a clothed person entering the water lead the Selsey crew to a late-night search.

programme.title: Rob and Rylans Passage to India
programme.desc: In Delhi, Rob and Rylan discover a tomb with a view, encounter a billionaire art collector, attempt their own rap performance, and try the ancient art of puppetry.

programme.title: Tár
programme.desc: Renowned musician Lydia Tár is days away from recording the symphony that will elevate her career. When all elements seem to conspire against her, Lydias adopted daughter Petra becomes an integral emotional support for her struggling mother.

programme.title: International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: Highlights of the third game of the T20 series between England and South Africa.

programme.title: The Guest
programme.desc: Ria faces the police while trying to pick up the pieces with Lee. But that will mean cutting Fran off entirely. Can she ever go back to her old life?

programme.title: Here We Go
programme.desc: Paul is going to be Altas godfather, but only if he gets himself baptised first.

programme.title: Chess Masters: The Endgame
programme.desc: The four finalists return for the last time to the Great Hall, ready to be put through their chess-playing paces like never before. Who will lift the winners trophy?

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Current affairs programme, featuring interviews and investigative reports on all aspects of life in Britain.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the final leg of his Midlands tour, Michael Portillo travels to Solihull, the home of iconic British brand Land Rover. Later, he visits the childhood neighbourhood of JRR Tolkien.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey across Essex. He heads to the ancient woodland of Epping Forest and learns of Audley End Houses role as a secret wartime military school.

programme.title: Deep Water Salvage
programme.desc: Jeremy Birch takes on a salvage to raise a vessel with a concrete hull thats been in the Fraser River for a month, adding 30 tons to its deadweight.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds gear up to shoot a new commercial for the store, but all Les cares about is putting out a good product.

programme.title: Dickinsons Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson is joined by Debbie Serpell, Stewart Hofgartner, David Tupman and Karen Dalmeny in Gloucester. A lovely old-fashioned clock turns up on Karens table, Debbie comes face-to-face with a real bargain hunter and who would have thought that six spoons could cause such a reaction!

programme.title: Container Wars
programme.desc: A container from Mexico may hold damaged goods, and the bids are high on a unique container.

programme.title: Container Wars
programme.desc: Mio and the Israelis team up on a container from Africa. Matt attacks for a can of Chinese goods. Strange items spark an intense bidding war.

programme.title: Container Wars
programme.desc: Four containers from New York make their way to Long Beach. Bidders are interested in a billionaires unclaimed goods, and a one-of-a-kind auction is held.

programme.title: Container Wars
programme.desc: Bidders battle over super heavyweight freight. A container filled with outdoor adventure equipment holds a surprise.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.sub-title: Bang, Zoom, Pawn on the Moon!
programme.desc: An autographed Apollo 10 book; Chum calls in Joey Fatone to get NSYNC on a collection of figurines; a set of Bob Hopes golf clubs putt into the shop; Rick steps right up for a chance to buy circus sideshow banners.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick says cheese as he cuts a deal on a vintage industrial slicer, while Chum enlists Alexs help on a rare World War II jacket. Meanwhile, Corey and Chum are offered a locked safe.

programme.title: Strange Evidence
programme.desc: An explorer seeking treasure at a Mayan sacrificial site is attacked by a strange underwater fog. Thousands of fish spontaneously jump to their deaths.

programme.title: Strange Evidence
programme.desc: A fire-breathing crater burns in the middle of a desert, and some suspect it is a gateway to hell. Also, a deadly shark is found lurking in a golf course water hazard. A giant white blob threatens a town in California.

programme.title: Worlds Most Unexplained
programme.desc: Death shall come on swift wings to him who disturbs the peace of the King so the famous inscription goes. Is there a real curse that haunts the original discoverers of Tutankhamun?

programme.title: Worlds Most Unexplained
programme.desc: A strange creature seen in a wooded area of rural Massachusetts by three different people who all give similar descriptions - coincidence, collusion or a genuine mystery?

programme.title: Strangest Things
programme.sub-title: The Skull That Changed Science, The Bat Bomb And The Stone Age Mulitool
programme.desc: How an appallingly injured skull changed the face of neuroscience. Asking if World War 2 really could have been won by a bat. And investigating if people really made sophisticated multipurpose tools 14,000 years ago.

programme.title: Cursed Histories
programme.desc: Investigating tales of intrigue, heartbreak, and deception that are so tragic that many people suspect the presence sinister forces. The host explores some of these ancient and modern mysteries and claimed curses.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: The Earl of Erroll: Death in the Valley
programme.desc: Discovering the truth of the unsolved murder of Josslyn Hay, 22nd Earl of Erroll, who was shot in Kenya in 1941, and why the only suspect was acquitted.

programme.title: Unsealed: Alien Files
programme.desc: Exploring the idea that aliens may have had a hand in humans technological advancements.

programme.title: Alien Files Unsealed

programme.title: Unsealed: Alien Files

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.sub-title: Caddy the Cadborosaurus, the Lubbock Lights, and Living Mummy
programme.desc: A fisherman possibly captures footage of a giant sea serpent, hundreds of people witness mysterious flashing blue and green lights in Lubbock, Texas, and a centuries-old monk attempts to mummify himself.

programme.title: Secrets in the Sky: The Untold Story of Skunk Works

programme.title: National Park Mysteries
programme.desc: Reports of sightings are made at Lassen Volcanic National Park of reptiles, known as reptoids, who work with aliens and can appear in human form.

programme.title: William Shatners Weird or What?
programme.desc: Stories of the human body reaching beyond the limits of modern medicine.

programme.title: William Shatners Weird or What?
programme.desc: A housewife has a strange and sudden vision that helps to solve a murder. A man remembers every single moment of his life.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: For thousands of years, people have believed in the existence of Satan, the embodiment of evil; some believe he has the power to possess souls and create mayhem amongst humanity.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: An exploration of the worlds most fascinating, strange and inexplicable mysteries. Compelling contributions from scientists, historians, and witnesses as they seek to shed light on how the impossible can happen.

programme.desc: A shakedown artist tries to make Les an offer he cant refuse, but the Golds fight back.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley pranks Seth to teach him a lesson; Les takes the plunge on a prison toilet.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A series of bogus pawns lead to a trusted employee; Karen handles a tough guy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les and Seth visit a customer with a garage full of amazing vintage cars; a male stripper shakes his money-maker before giving Byron the slip; Karen stumbles while making a big deal; Ashley forces a customer to kiss a Gremlin for money.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: With Ashley left in charge of the store, the employees go a little crazy; Karen gets caught putting on a fashion show during store hours and Bobby J gets called out for being rude to a customer.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen battle two auction hunters who bid based on spite instead of strategy, and a gatling gun and suit of armour are worth less than expected.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: A vintage American football passing machine and colonial musket are up for grabs in Philadelphia.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: A vicious battle erupts with former employee Carolyn over a 1968 Corvette Stingray, and Allen tests his ninja skills.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Two opponents best Ton and Allen, leaving them little chance to break even.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Its off to the dramatic scenery of County Kerry for dealer Ian and Butzy to see what Irish memorabilia he can invest in to turn over a profit. Its a struggle for Ian to get James to part with items at reasonable prices, but after some fierce haggling deals are struck.

programme.title: Alien Corridors

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: How did the Nazis produce technology that was far more advanced than anywhere else in a matter of years? Were they being helped by an extra-terrestrial source?

programme.title: Egypts Unexplained Files
programme.desc: An examination of new insights into belief and superstition in the land of the Pharaohs.

programme.title: Egypts Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Science shines a light on the dark side of Ancient Egypt, from a 5,000-year-old homicide to drug-fuelled debauchery - and one very shocking revelation.

programme.title: Egypts Unexplained Files
programme.sub-title: Ancient Icons in the Modern Age
programme.desc: The truth and lies behind some of Egypts most famous and beloved symbols.

programme.title: Egypts Unexplained Files
programme.desc: An exploration of the secrets of ancient Egypts health and wealth, including the worlds oldest case of breast cancer.

programme.title: Egypts Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Scientists and historians team up to investigate the impacts of volcanic eruptions on the fall of Egypts last dynasty.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Despite centuries of sightings and searches, one deep-sea monster remains unidentified. As evidence continues to mount, the mystery endures as to whether the Loch Ness monster exists.

programme.desc: Sula and Amma surprise Bing to show him Sulas sparkly painted butterfly face. Bing also wants a painted face, one that looks like Biteysaurus, and Sula says she can do it for him. Lets hope they prefer them when they are cooked in the momos. Choekyis recipe comes from Tibet, so when her friends arrive she greets them in a traditional Tibetan way.

programme.title: Educating Yorkshire
programme.desc: This documentary takes viewers inside the doors of Thornhill Community Academy near Dewsbury, highlighting what happens in the secondary school. Through highlighting the diverse institution, almost exactly half White British and half British-Asian, `Educating Yorkshire provides an insight into modern school life in the UK as it follows head teacher Jonny Mitchell, who tries to build upon recent improvements in exam results among the schools students. The programme also explores the universal themes of teenage life and the student-teacher relationships that are important in a young persons formative years.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Simon White and friend and neighbour Shirley Boyle are first to host at The Old Hall Country House in the picturesque village of Madeley in Cheshire. On arrival most of the guests are awed by the historical 16th century BandB. In the afternoon, Simon and Shirley take their guests tap dancing and in keeping with the five-star luxury to a private fine dining restaurant for dinner.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Its day two in the competition and the turn of cat-lover Eileen Finn to cater for her BandB competitors at the four-star Thornley House in Allendale, Northumbria. After being blown away by first hosts Simon and Shirley at the luxury Old Hall Country House, Eileen has her work cut out. Also, Eileens beloved and very large Maine Coon cats are not to all of her guests liking.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jessica and Adrian Rashleigh are third to host at their three bedroom establishment Chy Conyn in St Ives, on the beautiful Cornish coast. The hosts hope that what they lack for in size they will make up for in stunning surroundings. For the activity Jessica and Adrian take their guests on a magical mystery camper van tour of the local sights. At breakfast some of the guests struggle with the small breakfast room.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final hosts are Tim and Karen from The Cavendish in Bournemouth. The guests are initially impressed with the 16-bed `pink palace, but things go downhill when Simon and Shirley vigorously test their bed - and break it. Jessica and Adrian are worried that their room, situated right next to the front door, may mean a noisy night. Eileen however is delighted by the feline memorabilia left in her room as a special touch.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals reconvene for one last time to find out how much theyve been paid by their fellow BandB owners, and to sort out their differences. Simon White of Old Hall Country House is stunned by a generous overpayment, but Eileen Finn from the four-star Thornley is on the receiving end of some harsh criticism and some even harsher payments, and a shock underpayment leaves Tim from The Cavendish in Bournemouth reeling.

programme.sub-title: Where Have All the Floorboards Gone?

programme.desc: Sam dispatches Carla to get revenge on John Allen Hill - on horseback, and Cliff suffers from pony distress.

programme.desc: Henri upsets Woodys apple cart by proposing to Kelly, and Frasier turns to the Orient for pain relief.

programme.desc: When a young womans car is found abandoned on a bridge, police must consider three possibilities, including suicide, foul play and an intentional disappearance.

programme.desc: The judge must excuse the jury after an accused double-murderer goes on a rant; a DUI defendant wont listen to her lawyer; a laundromat vandal tries to suck up to the judge.

programme.desc: A judge lashes out at a defence attorney who referes to his drunk driving client as a hero; a religious leader convicted of sexual abuse hears from his victims.

programme.desc: A father risks everything when he attacks his sons killer in court; it takes eight bailiffs to bring down a defendant with nothing to lose; a man who spent twenty years in prison for a murder he didnt commit hopes for freedom; and more.

programme.desc: A grieving husband claims his wife accidentally fell to her death but investigators become suspicious after learning his first wife also died in a freak accident.

programme.title: Marooned With Ed Stafford
programme.desc: Adventurer Ed Stafford has walked the length of the Amazon River - he is the first person to accomplish that - and survived alone for 60 days on a desert island near Fiji (a feat chronicled in `Naked Castaway), so perhaps the challenges presented in `Marooned arent that daunting. Filmed in Venezuelas Gran Sabana mountains, Botswanas Okavango Delta, Romanias Carpathian Mountains, the Western Australia coast, and Borneos Brunei jungles, the five hourlong episodes see Stafford - a former British Army captain - attempt to last ten days in the harsh environments with nothing more than a camera. Viewers are provided a fly-on-the-wall perspective as Ed tries to find food, make fire, process water to drink, and build a shelter - among many other life-saving challenges.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer suspects Barts new friend Bashir of involvement with a terrorist plot to destroy the Springfield Mall.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: When Lisa discovers that honey-harvesters across the globe are dying out, she sets out on a crusade to save them. Unfortunately, her hopes rest on Mr Burns.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart exhibits worrisome behaviour when he takes an experimental drug for hyperactive children.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Guess Whos Coming to Criticize Dinner
programme.desc: Homer affects the way trendy people eat when he becomes a local food critic, until he starts giving restaurants bad reviews.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer causes an incident at the nuclear power plant, radiation from X-rays gives Bart and Lisa superpowers, and Flanders is killed.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Bart grow a highly addictive cross between tobacco and a tomato after moving to an old farm.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: After Homer becomes a celebrity by bowling a perfect game, he guest stars on `The Springfield Squares.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Some of Britains best loved famous faces share their sharp, insightful, funny and emotional views on popular and topical TV shows. From Saturday night entertainment juggernauts to the weeks biggest news stories, celebs become opinionated viewers.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britains sharpest armchair critics share more of their sharp, insightful, passionate and sometimes emotional critiques of the weeks biggest and best shows on television.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britains sharpest armchair critics share more of their sharp, insightful, passionate and sometimes emotional critiques of the weeks biggest and best shows on television.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Andrea and Stephan, mother and son, roll up for an evening of double dating. Seventy-year-old Diane refuses to let age get in the way of finding love. And bagpipe instructor Adam tries get back on song with fellow Scot Conor.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Chocolate expert Angus meets glam chocolate-lover Justine. Two fashionistas bond over a shared Harry Styles fixation. And sparks fly when a writer and a rock singer meet.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldons well-organised world is turned upside down when he learns that the barber who has cut his hair for years has passed away. As his orderly routines descend into chaos, he is forced to act like a hippy in order to match his shaggy new hairstyle. Meanwhile, Howard is sent to Houston for the gruelling NASA training programme and shares horrific stories about his experiences with Bernadette via Skype.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy gets upset with Sheldon when he breaks his promise to accompany her to her aunts birthday party and instead opts to join the guys for a `Star Wars video game marathon lasting the entire weekend. Later, Penny convinces Amy that she should confront Sheldon about the matter and demand an apology.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Desperate to find a `plus one to take to a wedding, Raj finally gives up and asks his parents to set him up with a date. Meanwhile, Penny buys Leonard and Sheldon some `Star Trek memorabilia, but she is irked when they refuse to play with the toys in case their value is diminished by removing them from the packaging.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam is torn between following Beverlys rules when it comes to off-campus lunch or going to the mall food court with his friends. After using Barrys college ID to get food at the dorm, Geoff becomes the student Barry wishes he could be.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam and Murray dont want to go on a camping trip, so father and son create a film faking it. Erica joins an all-girl a cappella group and learns an important lesson after taking over the group.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly buys a bicycle for Adam just like the one from `Pee Wees Big Adventure. Barry and Erica turn Murrays furniture store into an after-hours lounge for college students.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits the kitchens of six restaurants that he altered when they were about to close their doors.

programme.title: Hollyoaks: Omnibus
programme.desc: Mercedes crashes Tonys fundraiser, and Donny turns to alcohol. Meanwhile, as the Osbornes continue to despair about missing Morgan, Frankie receives a message. And Peris left heartbroken.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon heads to America in a bid to rescue failing restaurant owners from imminent disaster and provide them with a recipe for success. In this first episode, Gordon visits the Hot Potato Cafe in Fishtown, Philadelphia. With no profit made in its two years of trading and an influential restaurant reviewer dubbing them `Spuddy Hell, Gordon soon realises Hot Potato may have had its chips.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon visits Flamangos in rural Whitehouse, New Jersey. Mother and daughter owners Adele and Cheryl are stuck in their tropical ways but their restaurant is far from paradise. They are in deep financial trouble and Adele struggles to get on with her staff, is disappointed by her chef and hates Gordon with a passion. Gordon has one last chance to bring them all around and make the restaurant a success.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon travels to Pasadena, California to visit a Jamaican restaurant called Cafe Kingston. There, Gordon finds Dr Una Morris, a micro-managing owner who also works as a radiotherapist in a clinic next door to the restaurant. She is determined to use hospital techniques in her kitchen and is constantly sealing everything into plastic bags. Dr Morris is as stubborn as she is proud. Can Gordon help?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Stephen Hawking comes to lecture at the university for a week, Wolowitz is given the task of maintaining his wheelchair, making Sheldon green with envy. When Sheldon begs Wolowitz to introduce him to his hero Hawking, Wolowitz takes full advantage and only agrees after making Sheldon carry out a series of humiliating tasks, including doing his laundry, cleaning his room, and taking his mother dress shopping.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Koothrappali throw a classy bachelor party for Wolowitz, during which some stories about the future bridegrooms colourful sexual history are accidentally revealed. When Bernadette hears about it, she becomes upset and threatens to call off the wedding. Can Wolowitz win her over with a convincing explanation and a heartfelt apology to get the nuptials back on track?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard gets caught in an argument between his mum and Bernadette while at the International Space Station. Meanwhile, Ray is feeling lonely so Sheldon invites him along to his second anniversary date with Amy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon intervenes when he learns that Penny is thinking about breaking up with Leonard, but he is hampered by his inability to keep a secret. Meanwhile, in space, Howard is being picked on by the other astronauts.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its Biscuit Week, and the bakers make Hobnobs and memento time capsules. Whose keepsake crunch will see them hobnobbing as star baker? And whose time has crumb to an end?

programme.title: Home Alone 3
programme.desc: A quick-witted eight-year-old makes life miserable for four high-tech spies trying to recover a top-secret computer chip.

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: A cabaret singer witnesses a murder and goes undercover as a nun. In the convent, she is put in charge of coaching the choir, which she transforms into a toe-tapping rhythm group. As a result, the churchs congregation swells until even the Pope comes to witness pop classics such as `My Guy performed to glorify the Lord, but of course, her fame gives away her hiding place to the killer.

programme.title: LEGO Masters: Australia vs The World
programme.desc: In a colossal challenge, the teams design minifigs interacting with life-size household items, from a kitchen calamity to toilet troubles!

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge takes Bart and Lisa on a weekend excursion, and when an unexpected restaurant detour awakens their taste buds, fellow foodies Amuse Bruce and Fois Garth inspire them to start their own food blog.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: El Viaje Misterioso de Nuestro Jomer (The Mysterious Voyage of Homer)
programme.desc: Homer eats a dangerous chilli grown by Guatemalan psychiatric patients and embarks on a hallucinogenic trip through the deepest recesses of his mind, led by a talking coyote.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns gets into the plant-based burger business, Lisa refuses to believe hes up to no good.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge starts her own sandwich store, but running a business proves challenging when a rival opens up across the street.

programme.title: Moonfall
programme.desc: The world stands on the brink of annihilation when a mysterious force knocks the moon from its orbit and sends it hurtling toward Earth. With only weeks before impact, three unlikely heroes team up for a dangerous mission into space to save humanity.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britains sharpest armchair critics share more of their sharp, insightful, passionate and sometimes emotional critiques of the weeks biggest and best shows on television.

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc: Brendon and Priya want to explore Priyas bisexuality, but will her steamy hot tub and sensual time in the bedroom hit the spot? Chelsea and George disagree over how far they should take things.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Aaron, the winner of TVs `The Traitors, is out on a date with a straight-A student Laura. Theres also a date on roller skates, a reformed party girl, and a Mr Bean impression.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon travels to Pasadena, California to visit a Jamaican restaurant called Cafe Kingston. There, Gordon finds Dr Una Morris, a micro-managing owner who also works as a radiotherapist in a clinic next door to the restaurant. She is determined to use hospital techniques in her kitchen and is constantly sealing everything into plastic bags. Dr Morris is as stubborn as she is proud. Can Gordon help?

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Erica, Barry, Geoff and the gang go on a spring break trip and things dont go as expected. Adam questions if college is for him when his test scores are not as good as he was hoping for.

programme.title: Hue and Cry
programme.desc: The first of the classic `Ealing comedies in which a gang of East End youths turn the tables on the crooks who are using their favourite comic to pass coded communications.

programme.title: The Personal History of David Copperfield: Interview Speical
programme.desc: Director Armando Iannucci and actor Dev Patel, who stars in the title role, talk about bringing Charles Dickens beloved novel to the screen.

programme.title: Ferdinand
programme.desc: A bulls peaceful existence comes crashing down when authorities return him to his former captors. With help from a wisecracking goat and three hedgehogs, the giant but gentle bovine must find a way to escape before he meets a famous bullfighter.

programme.title: Babe
programme.desc: Engaging family tale based on Dick King-Smiths classic story about an orphaned piglet which is adopted by a sheepdog and learns how to herd sheep. Babe at first seems destined to end up on the dining table at Christmas, but the farmer realises that the animals unusual talent may bring him glory in the sheepdog trials.

programme.title: Babe: Pig in the City
programme.desc: Babe befriends the animal denizens of an urban jungle when he and Mrs Hoggett embark on a mission to save the farm.

programme.desc: A brilliant scientist invents Calisto -- a sustainable energy source that will revolutionize the way people use power. But when Calisto falls into the wrong hands, the Angels must retrieve it before it can be used as a weapon of mass destruction.

programme.title: The Lost City
programme.desc: A reclusive romance novelist on a book tour with her cover model gets swept up in kidnapping attempt that lands them them both in a cutthroat jungle adventure.

programme.title: The Shape of Water
programme.desc: Elisa is a mute, isolated woman who works as a cleaning lady in a hidden, high-security government laboratory in 1962 Baltimore. Her life changes forever when she discovers the labs classified secret -- a mysterious, scaled creature from South America that lives in a water tank. As Elisa develops a unique bond with her new friend, she soon learns that its fate and very survival lies in the hands of a hostile government agent and a marine biologist.

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.sub-title: Cook Like a Pro: Good Grilling
programme.desc: Ina Garten shares her advice for grilling and barbecuing like a pro; to start, hot coals work their magic on her Tuscan Grilled Cornish Hens, and she amps up the flavour on Foolproof Ribs with Barbecue Sauce.

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.sub-title: Cook Like a Pro: Herbs All Ways
programme.desc: Ina is cooking with herbs and sharing tips for turning up the flavour; she incorporates rosemary, oregano and mint in pork souvlaki with radish tzatziki and pitas for dinner; dill, chives and basil shine in heirloom tomatoes with herbed ricotta.

programme.title: Nigel Slaters Simple Cooking
programme.desc: Nigel Slater looks at how spicy flavours work so well with something cooling. From a classic chicken curry to a spicy tomato stew with yoghurt, Nigel shares some of his favourite dishes, and to prove just how versatile this food pairing is, he cooks up a new version of a traditional pudding. Nigel also travels to Bristol to meet a man who is passionate about pepper.

programme.title: Nigel Slaters Simple Cooking
programme.desc: Nigel Slater continues his exploration of brilliant culinary combinations, this time turning his attention to texture. Success in the kitchen is not just about tastes and flavours; contrasting textures can really lift a dish. He makes a classic savoury pie with a puff pastry crust, and a reworking of his favourite childhood pudding: poached pears.

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James continues his British adventure in Lancashire with top local chef Lisa Allen in the passenger seat of his trusty red mini. Their first stop is an incredible food hall in Lisas home town of Clitheroe. Here they shop and then cook together a fantastic BBQd john dory with kohlrabi and fennel salad. Next, Lisa is in the driving seat as she takes the mini to a local buffalo farm where theyre producing some interesting cheese from buffalo milk.

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James adventure brings him over the border into North Wales, where hes joined by chef Stephen Terry for this leg of his journey. Their first stop is the grand Pale Hall, where head chef Gareth Stevenson is cooking up a real treat - Moroccan-inspired Welsh lamb. James offers his own variation of Welsh lamb in the grounds of the hall, serving with gnocchi and vegetables. Next, one of James boyhood dreams comes true as he has the ultimate falconry experience.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: Featuring pasties, fresh mackerel, pigeon and peas and clotted cream, all products of his beloved Cornwall.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: This edition includes happy pigs from the Isle of Wight, real cider from Somerset, peppery watercress from Hampshire streams, and Thomas Hardys favourite cheese.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: Featuring free-range geese in Leicestershire, bitter from Southwold, some delicious kippers, and free-range pork from the Suffolk Black.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: In Lancashire, Rick samples a traditional hotpot and some mouthwatering cheese, and in the Lake District he finds wild boar and the famous Herdwick sheep.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: Rick samples whelks in Bognor Regis, prepares steak and kidney pudding, explores the herbal delights of a walled garden in Sussex, and backs a campaign to save the sea bass.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: A visit to East Anglia and the Midlands, where he comes across a host of specialities, including Norfolk Black turkeys, Lincolnshire chine, speciality pork pies and the champion of British cheeses, Stilton.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: In Wakefield, Rick meets Janet Oldroyd, whose family have been harvesting rhubarb for the past four generations, and they whip up a tasty rhubarb crumble. Then in Bradford, he discovers the perfect recipe for lamb karahi at a Karachi restaurant.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: Rick and his little hairy friend, Chalky, pay a visit to Ricks favourite formal vegetable garden, at Chatsworth House. He crosses the River Severn to sample the delights of Wales, including cawl and Welsh Black cattle.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.sub-title: Crispy Chicken and Sweet Potato Burger
programme.desc: Jamie rustles up a quick crispy breaded chicken for the family and he shows how to transform a burger by using sweet potato in two new ways.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.desc: Jamie cooks up a baked casserole and he shows a way to dress an aubergine salad, served with the quickest homemade flatbreads.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri digs into righteous regional flavours where you may not expect to find them, like Cajun jambalaya in Bend, Ore.; Pakistani oxtail in Chehalis, Wash.; a tiki joint in Houston serves elevated dumplings and honey butter chicken biscuits.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri rolls into a tucked-away panini paradise in Chehalis, Wash.; a Korean spot in Brentwood, Tenn., gets spicy with their chicken and bulgogi; in Houston, a barbecue joint throws Tex-Mex into the mix with brisket tacos and jalapeno sausage.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: In Bend, Ore., a bagel shop is loading up pastrami; a Venezuelan spot in Salt Lake City is making amazing arepas; a Nashville joint is putting their twist on Jamaican specialities.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Bend, Ore., where a funky spot stuffs their buns with unexpected flavors; a Puerto Rican oasis in Utah cooks real deal mofongo, and a Nashville joint serves coal-fired pizza.

programme.title: Cutthroat Kitchen: Knives Out
programme.desc: Brian Malarkey challenges the chefs to create a campsite slider feast in 30 minutes with limited ingredients, a single-burner camp stove, and minimalist cooking tools. Judge Maneet Chauhan selects the tastiest stacked slider.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri tracks down off-the-chain chicken, starting in Salt Lake City with a unique curry-chicken mashup. In Albuquerque, NM, the chicken is down-home fried alongside sweet waffles, and in Grand Junction, CO, its nested in tacos with guacamole.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris got Asian flavours, an American classic and some mashups in between. In Anchorage, AK, theres a Korean-Mexican joint rolling out kimchi burritos, and a funky fusion spot in Albuquerque, NM, heads off the charts with the bomb pork belly.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris loading up on things meaty, cheesy and a little sweet, like wild waffles in Anchorage, AK, and sizzlin steak tacos in Aspen, CO. Plus, in Albuquerque, NM, a lights-out Latin joint is going big with their amazing arepas and pork paninis.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris digging into appetisers, dessert and everything in-between. In Laramie, WY, an old-school cafe is loadin up green-chili burritos and scratch-made pie. A spot in Anchorage, AK, is going next level with their blackened chicken gnocchi.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris grabbing all kinds of funky flavour, starting in Laramie, WY, where a restaurant-bar is pilin up their nachos, and a longtime spot is cooking up a vegetarian banh mi. Then, a Mexican joint in Alaska is serving dynamite duck tacos.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris diving into Asian flavours alongside a taste of Italy, starting at a Vietnamese spot in Albuquerque, NM, thats servin up out-of-bounds banh mi. Plus, in Anchorage, AK, a real deal Italian deli is adding magic to their sandwiches.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris diggin into dishes perfect for pickin up and chowin down, like a bomb barbecue pie at a pizza-bakery in Laramie, WY. Then, a funky Cleveland bar is making monster tots, and a Vietnamese spot in Anchorage, AK, is cookin up crepes.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris hitting up joints owned by Food Network super chefs, like Maneet Chauhan, who is serving up her creative spin on Indian recipes in Nashville. Then, in Cleveland, Guy joins Michael Symon, firing up pork belly at his barbecue spot.

programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri dives into killer culinary and cocktails, from an over-the-top Mexican spot in San Antonio, Texas, to a hidden speakeasy in Brunswick, Georgia.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri road trips across America to check out classic greasy spoons. With a new generation of owners and delicious homemade food, these are the kind of places that make America special.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: In Des Moines, Iowa, unique smoked wings and an apple dumpling dessert, in West Des Moines, an Ecuadorian spot serving chicken with rice and pork with hominy, in Eugene, Ore., fresh caught Dungeness crab and crayfish pie.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy Fieris caught up in a whirlwind of flavours. In Norfolk, VA, he finds a two-for-one spot where a butcher stacks sandwiches by day and a chef fires up ramen and sticky wings by night.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Casey travels to historic Boston for some epic New England eats, including a burger topped with Thanksgiving favourites, a plate-sized serving of prime rib and a 4.5-pound Irish breakfast challenge at Flann OBriens Pub.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Casey travels to Louisville, Kentucky, for some epic eats, including a booze-infused Southern staple, a one-of-a-kind spicy popcorn, and frozen hot chocolate challenge in nearby Santa Claus.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Casey sails to Philadelphia to tackle the epic Classic Whale Challenge, a 6 kg bagel sandwich stuffed with cream cheese, nova salmon, whitefish, tomatoes and onions.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Casey heads to Los Angeles, where he samples a burger crossed with a pizza. Then, he takes on the Zombie Burrito challenge, during which he tries to demolish a burrito laden with ghost pepper-fuelled death sauce and zombie sauce.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb heads to Pittsburgh for a five-pound sandwich loaded with meat, cheese, fries, and coleslaw.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb travels to Burlington, Vermont, where he devours a beer-infused bagel feast and a burger with donut buns made in a school bus. Casey participates in the Chuck Norris challenge at Handys Lunch.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Casey visits St, Louis, Missouri, in search of the biggest and best the city has to offer. He encounters a four-pound meatball and tackles a New York-style pizza so massive hell need the help of a partner to take it down.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Casey travels to Seattle where he climbs a Mount Fuji-sized burger and takes on seven terrifyingly spicy Buffalo wings that have defeated over 5,000 challengers.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.sub-title: Crispy Chicken and Sweet Potato Burger
programme.desc: Jamie rustles up a quick crispy breaded chicken for the family and he shows how to transform a burger by using sweet potato in two new ways.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.desc: Jamie cooks up a baked casserole and he shows a way to dress an aubergine salad, served with the quickest homemade flatbreads.

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James and Stephen head south through Wales en route to Pembrokeshire. But before they get there, they stop to visit Gareth Ward and his stunning restaurant Ynyshir. After filling their bellies, they make it to the coast where James cooks up his Marloes Sands seafood parcel. Stephen tracks down Wales answer to Willy Wonka, young chocolatier Liam Burgess, who helps him make a very special one-off-chocolate bar for James.

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James British adventure has crossed over the Irish sea to Northern Ireland, where he is joined by his great pal and famous local chef, Paul Rankin. Their first port of call is the Giants Causeway, where James settles right in and cooks up a fish stew for the crowds of tourists. Paul goes in search of Irish gold and finds it in the form of rapeseed at the Kane family farm in Limavady.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The contestants bake rye bread rolls, ciabatta loaves and a filled centrepiece loaf that must make an impact on the table as well as on the judges.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The bakers cook saucy puds filled with a gooey filling, Marys tiramisu cake and a showstopping baked Alaska made of cake, meringue and ice cream.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The contestants bake sweet custard tarts, mini pear pies and finally a towering collection of pies from any pastry or pastries they like.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The bakers prepare yeast-leavened cakes, a Swedish princess torte and a contemporary version of the Dobos Torte. Whose `Bake Off will come to a sweet but sticky end?

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The bakers make signature savoury parcels, kouign amann and two types of showstopping doughnuts, which they hope will secure them a place in the quarter-finals.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its the quarter-finals and the remaining five are tasked with baking enriched sweet fruit loaves, an Eastern European cross between a bread and a pastry, and 36 showstopping doughnuts.

programme.title: James Martins Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Galton Blackiston, his pal and a top-class, Michelin-starred chef. They don diving suits to swim with seals, and hire an unusual mode of transport to take them around the islands. Galton visits a sea salt farm and delivers some back to James, who uses it to cook up some wonderful salt-baked sea bass. James finds an unusual restaurant situated in the middle of a post office, and finishes off the day cooking roast duck by a stunning seashore.

programme.title: James Martins Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James returns to one of his favourite places in the UK: the beautiful county of Cornwall. Joining him is his close pal and Michelin-starred chef Galton Blackiston. During their trip they discover some world-class Cornish ice cream, and Galton visits Newlyn fish market to pick up some Cornish cod. James cooks the cod along with Cornish oysters and a warm tartare sauce. They both round off the day with a painting challenge on Sennen beach, where they try out their oil painting skills.

programme.title: James Martins Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: On the next leg of his UK tour, James is joined in glorious Devon by his friend and Michelin-starred chef Simon Hulstone. James visits an extraordinary mushroom farm situated in a bungalow, and makes a tasty steak and mushroom dish. Simon samples some award-winning cheese, which inspires James to make a cheese platter fit for a king. The day ends with a trip to the Art Deco splendour of Burgh Island.

programme.title: James Martins Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by pal and Michelin-starred chef Mark Jordan, and together they set out to explore the delights of Jersey aboard mini motor bikes. James samples the delights of one of Jerseys most famous exports, the Jersey Royal potato, and he uses them to cook up a squid risotto with a difference. Mark Jordan gets a lesson in oyster shucking, and James discovers an island speciality: Jersey black butter, which he uses to create a delicious sweet treat.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris travelling with Antonia Lofaso on a culinary journey through Puerto Rico. In Old San Juan, theyre diggin into a chicken-trifongo combo; a spot in Juncos is servin up plantain-picadillo lasagna and a stew made with pigs feet.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris doubling up with sweet and savoury, both hot and cold. There are chicken and steak arepas in San Juan, Puerto Rico, winning wings from a funky food truck in Laramie, WY, and an ice cream-cake combo; a raclette-ramen mashup in Cleveland.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris worldwide journey of flavour starts in Caguas, Puerto Rico, with churrasco steak and risotto and ropa vieja dumplings. He also grabs tandoori chicken and samosas in Middleton, NJ, and next-level Filipino dishes in Cleveland.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris grabbing a little surf, turf and flavours from the earth. In Puerto Rico, a local gem is serving off-the-hook pork trifongo and shrimp empanadas. Plus, Guy finds a mushroom po boy in Somerville, NJ, and outrageous octopus in Cleveland.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining central region chefs do battle for a place in the national finals. They must impress the formidable panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton with their four course menus.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew is attempting to pay tribute to NHS staff with his innovative take on a traditional healing recipe, `Mums Flu Fighting Chicken Soup. Jasons `A Tea From The Heart is a play on a post-war remedy which harks back to the era when the NHS was formed. And Chris is hoping to impress with his dish inspired by a therapeutic hospital garden featuring foraged herbs from the Welsh valley where he lives including wild chervil, pickled pine buds and yarrow tips.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After the starter results, the chefs return to the kitchen hoping for high scores with their fish dishes. Chris once again is using ingredients he has foraged from around his restaurant, while Jason hopes to impress with a spicy scallop dish and Andrew prepares a cod dish with 11 different elements.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are pulling out all the stops in a bid for big scores with their mains. All three dishes pay tribute to the founder of the NHS Aneurin Bevan, Chriss `Everything But The Squeal is an ambitious pork sharing platter, while Jasons `For The Rich And The Poor showcases lamb, and Andrew is hoping to impress with `Aneurin Bevan For Better Steak.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the dessert course and the last opportunity for the chefs to impress. Chris is hoping to triumph with another dish which showcases the foraged ingredients available around his restaurant, while Jason attempts a technical feat in his dessert inspired by a childhood hospital stay and Andrew is inspired by a dish by his great grandmother used to cook. Which two will make it through to the judging chamber?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Wales regional final as the two remaining chefs do everything they can to impress the judging panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. After tensions ran high in the week, the chefs are under pressure to deliver perfection. The judges are joined by Aneira Thomas, the first baby born on the NHS, who is named in tribute to the services founder Aneurin Bevan and who went on to dedicate her life to the service. Who will win a place in the national finals?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the turn of three chefs representing the South West, including two who have competed before but meet in the kitchen this week for the very first time.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the fish course and with Tom renowned as a fish specialist all eyes are on him. Hes cooking his take on a classic British fish supper in tribute to a charity which looks after the health of local fishermen. Jude is attempting a complex fusion dish featuring four different fish and an unusual X Ray themed presentation, while Olivia is paying tribute to the staff who looked after her during the birth of her first son with her take on curried monkfish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the main course and two of the chefs are hoping duck will win the day. Tom is preparing a technically challenging duck dish steeped in NHS history while Jude is making a multi-element Chinese duck dish inspired by his mum. Olivia is hoping her dish, using two unusual cuts of beef, will score top points. Olivia also visits her local childrens hospital, home of the second busiest paediatric AandE in the country.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With just one more chance to impress their veteran judge, the chefs are all hoping to use their pastry skills to deliver technically complex desserts. Toms cooking an `Invalid Fruit Tart inspired by a 1950s recipe, while Jude is making six different apple elements for his `An Apple A Day. Olivia is using stout in reference to an outdated old wives tale which suggested the drink was a healthy source of iron during pregnancy.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its time for the two remaining chefs representing the South West to go head to head as they cook their menus again for the exacting panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. With a spot in the National Finals at stake, both are aiming for perfection as they bid for glory. The judges are joined by Barbara Childs, a Matron in the Cardiac Intensive Care Unit at Great Ormond Street Hospital, who isnt afraid to speak her mind in the chamber.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs take to the kitchen in a bid to represent the North West in the national final. They include Ellis Barrie, from the award winning Marram Grass in Anglesey, Liam Simpson-Trotman, an accomplished pastry chef and co-owner of the 4 AA rosette Orwells in Oxfordshire, and Craig Sherrington, who sharpened his skills working under top names including Eric Chavot and is now Chef Patron of Virginia House in Cumbria.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the fish course and the chefs are all gunning for tens. Craig pays tribute to a friend who has revolutionised hospital food in Morecambe Bay, while Liam is inspired by health advice his grandma gave him and Ellis is dedicating his dish to the staff who delivered his son Albert. With cod, mackerel, shrimp and cockles on the menu, which of the chefs will score highly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Time for the chefs to cook their mains and the pressure is on. Craig is hoping to impress using two cuts of Dexter beef, while Liam prepares his take on a Bajan lamb stew and Ellis prepares four cuts of suckling pig. Liam meets his personal hero, Nola Ishmael OBE, who became the UKs first ever black Director of Nursing.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the dessert course and the last chance for the North West chefs to impress in a bid to make it through to the regional final. Liam is cooking `Not So Hot Toddy in honour of a friend who works nightshifts in the NHS, while Ellis `Worth Their Weight in Gold is dedicated to the staff who saved his brothers life and Craigs dish `The Missed Celebration pays tribute to his wife with an unusual Christmas concept.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the week return to cook their menus again. Judging them are Matthew Fort, Oliver Peyton and Andi Oliver who are joined by Dr Jake Dunning MBE, an infectious disease specialist who has been recognised for his work during the West Africa Ebola epidemic.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs are doing battle to represent Northern Ireland. Tommy Heaney, Head Chef at the Great House Hotel in South Wales is taken on by Shauna Froydenlund, Chef Patron at Marcus Warings two Michelin starred restaurant and James Devine, the 2017 National Chef of the Year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course, the chefs return to the kitchen to cook their fish dishes. James is making his elevated take on a fried chicken takeaway as a tribute to the NHS staff who care for his sister. Shauna is also taking inspiration from a personal connection with a tribute to staff from a facility in her hometown of Londonderry. Tommy is hoping to impress with a dish dedicated to the discovery of DNA.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With two courses down its time for the chefs to cook their main courses. Its the battle of beef with each using the same meat in their innovative creations. Tommy also meets the first baby ever born on the NHS.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its dessert course and the final chance for the chefs to impress. After such a tightly fought battle all week, each is hoping to deliver a technically perfect dessert. Tommy and James are both using passion fruit in their complex dishes while Shauna is hoping to use her pastry chef training to score full marks.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs representing Northern Ireland go head to head. Judging as ever are Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver who are joined by Shehan Hettiaratchy, lead trauma surgeon at St Marys Hospital who helped treat victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winning chefs from all 8 regions must now battle it out for the honour of a spot on 2018s `Feast To Say Thank You banquet menu, celebrating 70 years of the NHS, one of Britains most prized institutions.Each day the regional champions will be cooking one of their courses again for the discerning panel of judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but after some exceptionally high scoring dishes in the starter round, everyone is desperate to deliver perfection in order to see off the competition. Once again the chefs present their innovative, witty or heart warming creations, with lobster, mackerel, John Dory, turbot and hake among the dishes being scrutinized.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. Both chefs and judges alike are amazed at the high standard of cooking and an incredible number of 10s are dished out as the chefs serve up venison, rabbit, duck, beef, lamb and pork for scrutiny.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its dessert day and with just one place remaining at the banquet feast, each chef is giving everything theyve got for a chance to say thank you to the heroic NHS staff. All the chefs have significantly re-worked or re-invented their desserts since the regional heats, proving that theyll do everything they can in a bid for that final winning spot.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the grand finale as the winning chefs cook their dishes at a banquet for the heroes of the NHS. Having arrived at St Bartholomews Hospital, the chefs are shown the incredible location for event, the almost three hundred year old Great Hall.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs compete in the heat for the central region. Returner Ryan Simson-Trotman, who failed to reach the national finals last year, is originally from Nuneaton and opened his own restaurant Orwells in the Oxfordshire countryside with his partner Liam, who is also a contestant in the North West region.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the fish course and the chefs are pulling out all the stops. Marianne pays tribute to the `angels in her local hospital who looked after her during a recent illness. Ryans dish is a reference to the purported health benefits of fish high in omega 3 oils. While Sabrina is inspired by her aunt, a retired nurse who used to take in food to share with her fellow workers during her shifts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their mains and following yesterdays results, tension is high. Both Marianne and Ryan are cooking muntjac in the hope of impressing the veteran judge, while Sabrina is making an ambitious technical take on a family feast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With one dish left to impress the veteran judge, the chefs cook their desserts. Marianne is looking to raise a smile with her `carry on themed dessert, complete with surprise presentation. Sabrina hopes to make it through with an elevated take on jelly and ice cream while Ryan goes all out with his very sweet treat `A Spoonful of Sugar.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining central region chefs do battle for a place in the national finals. They must impress the formidable panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton with their four course menus.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The spotlight is on Scotland. Returning contenders Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Mark Greenaway are all determined to get one of their dishes to the banquet. Will a witty take on spiced ham score highly, or will a warm chicken salad with a twist or a rabbit terrine come out on top? Veteran judge Angela Hartnett MBE will be judging.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Mark Greenaway cook their fish dishes. Will a traditional Scottish soup, a chowder or a risky no-cook mackerel dish impress veteran judge Angela Hartnett MBE?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The competition heats up as the three returning Scottish contenders, Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Mark Greenaway, cook their main courses. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish returning contenders Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Mark Greenaway have just one more chance to impress veteran judge Angela Hartnett MBE and win their place in front of the judges. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent Scotland and cook at a special banquet at the Royal Albert Hall.

programme.desc: The curtain raises on the competition in the North West. How will Aiden Byrnes dish entitled `Mad as a Box of Frogs go down with veteran Phil Howard?
