programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is tasked with helping a couple who have a £500,000 budget and a dream of leaving their city life in Bristol behind them and finding their perfect country home in Monmouthshire. While in the county, keen archaeologist Jules visits the village of Trellech, where local excavation efforts are unearthing what could be the largest medieval settlement in Wales.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin is rural property hunting in Argyll and Bute with a couple from Ayr who want to invest their £350,000 budget in a property with priceless countryside views. While in the region, Jonnie heads to the shores of Loch Fyne and visits Inveraray Castle, one of Scotlands finest stately homes and ancestral seat of the Dukes of Argyll for the past three hundred years.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is on a house hunting mission in the Forest of Dean helping a couple with a £500,000 budget find a perfect country home that meets their specific demands for the garden. While in the area, Sonali visits Ragmans Lane Farm and discovers how market gardening produces not just organic food, but is also a financial leg-up for small-scale vegetable growers trying to break into the farming industry.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton is in rural Shropshire with a couple who hope their £500,000 budget will buy them a shorter commute to work and more quality time together to enjoy the outdoors. programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman is in rural Gloucestershire helping an intrepid aunt and niece with a budget of £600,000 find a country home for two generations, that could also furnish them with an income. programme.desc: Sonali Shah is on a house hunting mission in the Forest of Dean helping a couple with a £500,000 budget find a perfect country home that meets their specific demands for the garden. While in the area, Sonali visits Ragmans Lane Farm and discovers how market gardening produces not just organic food, but is also a financial leg-up for small-scale vegetable growers trying to break into the farming industry.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton is in rural Shropshire with a couple who hope their £500,000 budget will buy them a shorter commute to work and more quality time together to enjoy the outdoors. Away from the excitement of the property search, Alistair meets Sam Gray, a passionate small holder, who rears her rare breed pigs ethically and balances the business of farming with raising her young family.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Dawn and Russ have lived in Farnborough for 25 years, but now want more peace and more nature.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple who have decided to leave city life behind. They would like a place in the west of Wales, where their ponies have more space. In Pembrokeshire, Jules visits Lammas, Britains first eco-village.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman is in rural Gloucestershire helping an intrepid aunt and niece with a budget of £600,000 find a country home for two generations, that could also furnish them with an income. Along the way, Nicki heads to Owlpen Manor and hears the story of how this Cotswold Tudor building was rescued from its `sleeping beauty state after a hundred years of disrepair, and restored by the family who now call it home.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton is in the Cornish countryside house hunting with a couple planning an escape from the busy suburbs of Surrey, and with their £350,000 budget would like to move their family of five to rural Cornwall. Alistair also heads to West Cornwalls rugged coast and courageously joins a team of passionate seaweed collectors to dive and harvest this edible, sustainable superfood.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is tasked with helping a couple who have a £500,000 budget and a dream of leaving their city life in Bristol behind them and finding their perfect country home in Monmouthshire. While in the county, keen archaeologist Jules visits the village of Trellech, where local excavation efforts are unearthing what could be the largest medieval settlement in Wales.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Another British couple decide to swap the grey skies of Britain for sun, sea and sand abroad.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Frans and Julie Mampaeij from Berkshire want to buy a holiday home in Almeria. Scarlette Douglas shows them five fantastic properties.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ian and Maria want to buy their first property together in their favourite location on Spains Costa del Sol, Estepona. Jasmine Harman searches every nook and cranny of the local market.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jane and Jilly from Brighton want to buy a holiday home in the picturesque Dordogne region of south-west France, on a budget of £100,000.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps Cheshire couple Alison and Stephen find a holiday home in the charming town of Marseillan in the South of France. With a budget of £115,000, they are spoilt for choice.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Merwyn and Liesl from London are ready to make their dream of buying a Spanish holiday home come true. They hope they will like one of the five Danni Menzies shows them on the Orihuela Costa.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara renovates a 1960s Colonial home thats lacking character; she brings the propertys potential to life by designing spaces to enjoy the outdoors and incredible views.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara tackles a 1952 Traditional home with a massive open concept living space; upstairs she adds a luxurious coffee area to the main suite while adding an entertaining area to the basement.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.sub-title: Cant See the House From the Trees
programme.desc: Tamara tackles a Colonial-style home with a yard thats been seriously neglected; she must tame the overgrown grounds before putting traditional Kansas City charm into the interior with a brand-new kitchen and main suite.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Battle of Okinawa: Operation Iceberg
programme.desc: Insight into the Battle of Okinawa, the largest assault of the Pacific campaign.

programme.title: Dogfight Over Guadalcanal
programme.desc: The true story of two pilots, one American and the other Japanese, who confronted each other during a key WWII battle and, for some mysterious reason, did not shoot each other down.

programme.title: Lost City Of Gaul: Unearthing Bibracte
Journeys to the Ends of the Earth
programme.sub-title: Peru: The Lost City Of Gold
programme.desc: Photojournalist David Adams searches for the Lost City of the Incas in the jungles of Peru.

programme.title: Quest for the Lost Tribes
programme.desc: Filmmaker Simcha Jacobovic searches the globe for answers and investigates the lost tribes of Israel. From 12 mentioned in the Bible only Judah and Benjamin remain after they survived the Assyrian purge of nearly three millennia ago.

programme.title: Forbidden Knowledge: Forgotten Cities Lost in Time
Immortal Egypt with Joann Fletcher
programme.desc: In the first episode Prof. Joann Fletcher goes in search of the building blocks of Egyptian civilisation and what made Ancient Egypt the incredible civilisation that it was. She sees how people here changed, in just a few centuries, from primitive farmers to pyramid builders and finds the early evidence for Egypts amazing gods and obsession with death and the afterlife.

programme.title: Immortal Egypt with Joann Fletcher
programme.desc: In the second episode Joann explores how the Pyramid Age ended in catastrophe. In one of Saqqaras last pyramid complexes, Joann uncovers evidence of famine as the young Egyptian state suffered a worsening climate and political upheaval.

programme.title: Ramesses The Great - Legendary Pharoah of Ancient Egypt
programme.desc: Ramesses the Great, born in the 14th century BC, was part of Egypts prosperous Bronze Age era.

programme.title: Immortal Egypt with Joann Fletcher
programme.desc: In the third episode Joann explores the magnificent Colossi of Memnon built under Egypts greatest pharaoh, Amenhotep III. Joann explores the dizzying heights of Egypts civilisation, and the lives of the workers and artisans caught up in Egypts most ambitious building projects: the Valley of the Kings.

programme.title: Immortal Egypt with Joann Fletcher
programme.desc: Joann discovers how Egypts enemies exploited a country weakened by internal strife, ultimately leading to its destruction. Joann leaves Egypt and journeys south to Sudan where she finds the remarkable story of the forgotten Nubian Kings.

programme.title: Egypts Stolen Treasures
programme.desc: From Nefertiti to Queen Tiye, lets take a look at the ancient Egyptian treasures housed in the Neues Museum Berlin, filled with spoils of war.

programme.title: Enigmas of the Ancient World
programme.desc: Uncovering some the secrets of our past, from ancient civilizations to great works of art.

programme.title: Secrets and Mysteries of Christopher Columbus
programme.desc: Investigating the true origins of Christopher Columbus through historical records and testimony from experts and Columbus living relatives.

programme.title: The Relics of Egypt: Exploring the Largest Museum in the World
programme.desc: A stones throw from the iconic Cheops pyramids, another famous creation rises, towering over the Giza plateau: the Grand Egyptian Museum. The new museum houses thousands of archaeological artefacts, including the funerary mask of Tutankhamun.

programme.title: Sudan: The Mystery Of The African Pharoahs
programme.desc: David Adams journey through down the Nile from Lake Nasser to Khartoum reveals a side of Sudan that is rarely seen. At one time, this area was home to a sophisticated civilisation with an ancient monarchy.

programme.title: Egypt Detectives
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Animal Mummies
programme.desc: Archaeologist Miriam Cooke and Egyptologist Dominic Montserrat attempt to unravel some of the most intriguing mysteries which the Ancient Egyptians have left behind.

programme.title: The Story of Egyptology
programme.desc: Dr. Chris Naunton delves into the rediscovery of Ancient Egypt, tracing its discovery from early travelers.

programme.title: Ancient Egypt: Life and Death in the Valley of the Kings
programme.desc: Egyptologist Dr Joann Fletcher discovers what life was really like for ordinary Egyptians 3,500 years ago, during the height of the incredible civilisation of ancient Egypt. Joann explores how people lived during this time, from the tightly packed houses and villages of the common people, to the clothes they wore and the food they ate.

programme.desc: A terraced house in Stoke, a huge office in Ashford and a listed Victorian house in Plymouth are all renovated over very different timescales from a few months to four years.

programme.desc: Lucy finds hidden depths in a Ramsgate listed building while Martin meets a buyer whos more than a little surprised by his auction purchase in Dunmurry, Northern Ireland. In Earls Court, London, we find a little flat with big potential.

programme.desc: Jessika Rovell falls for Jeffrey Marsaliss charm and good looks. But when she discovers his secret online life, she realises shes been dating a monster.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: Eight-year old Zachary Bernhardt disappears from his Florida home late at night while his mum is out. When another boy goes missing, new theories emerge.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: 14-year-old Ashley Summers vanishes in 2007. The mystery deepens when the FBI connects her case to two other young women missing from her neighbourhood.

programme.title: Murder in the Heartland
programme.desc: A roommate reports 22-year-old Liz Syperda missing, shocking the community of Mount Pleasant, Iowa. Some wonder if Liz merely left town without telling anyone, but family and friends know something far more disastrous occurred.

programme.title: Murder in the Heartland
programme.desc: A local in Algona, Iowa, stumbles upon a smouldering truck with the body of a young mother inside; investigators and family trace the last movements of Nicole Berte to uncover her killer.

programme.title: Truth About Murder With Sunny Hostin
programme.desc: Sunny Hostin examines a perplexing case in which Malinada Gibbons, a pregnant woman, was found brutally raped and murdered in her own home.

programme.title: Murder in the Heartland

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: An unidentified corpse is dragged out of a river, the only clue to its identity being a driving licence found on the body. Frost is intrigued to discover that the owner of the licence is alive and has no connection with the dead man. Meanwhile, the star player of Denton Athletic collapses at a press conference.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: This final series sees Martin making efforts to overcome his phobia and beginning to question whether he made the right decision about resigning. He and Louisa have also welcomed a baby daughter, Mary Elizabeth, who is a sister for four-year-old James Henry.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The surgery is chaotic with both Martin and Louisa now practising from it. Berts new business venture with Al isnt off to a good start and Penhale suspects noise complaints are due to paranormal activity.

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Happiest Days of Your Life
programme.desc: Pop and Ma Larkin are summoned to the twins school and advised that the disruptive Zinnia and Petunia would be better suited to a boarding school.

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Happiest Days of Your Life
programme.desc: The twins are found safe and sound after running away from boarding school, Pop becomes involved with the renovation of the school - much to the delight of the headmistress, and Primrose asks Charley for some advice about love.

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crackd From Side to Side
programme.desc: Hollywood movie star Marina Gregg takes up residence in St Mary Mead with her film director husband. The glamorous couple throws a party, but things get ugly when a fan in attendance ends up dead from a poisoned cocktail. Can Marple solve the mystery?

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: After Jeanie Long commits suicide, evidence comes to light exonerating her for the murder of teenager Abigail Mantel 11 years earlier. DCI Vera Stanhope and her team set out to retrospectively solve the killing, delving into the secrets and lies of a small community which still feels the repercussions of Abigails death. Then, the case takes an violent and unexpected turn.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Trouble seems to be brewing in the pretty village of Ford Florey when a tract of waste ground dubbed `the Swamp becomes the focus of a land dispute between two old agricultural families and a band of travellers. Things get nasty at the towns annual fair when a woman is shot for real during a shootout reconstruction at the Wild West show. Barnaby and Jones uncover a series of seething grudges within the village.

programme.title: Downton Abbey: A New Era
programme.desc: The Crawley family goes on a grand journey to the South of France to uncover the mystery of the dowager countesss newly inherited villa.

programme.title: Downton Abbey Celebrates the Grand Finale
programme.desc: Join the cast of Downton Abbey in a toast to the global phenomenons final chapter featuring special conversations with the beloved cast of the highly anticipated third and final film as they reunite at Londons famed Savoy Hotel.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope investigates a mysterious double murder in a remote country manor house. After the man who was minding the house is killed in a hit-and-run, Vera and DC Aiden Healy then discover the body of moth enthusiast Martin Nielson stabbed to death on the dining room floor. Captivated by the strange circumstances surrounding these two murders, Vera and her team attempt to build a clearer picture of what happened the night before.

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Sandy feels the heat in the aftermath of Calums suicide, after she admits she gave him the pen that he used to kill himself. Also, convinced that McGuire is the key to cracking the case, Perez travels to Glasgow in an attempt to track him down.

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: A murder mystery set against the stunning Scottish backdrop of the Shetland Isles.

programme.desc: Chief Inspector Japp seeks Poirots help with a series of unsolved jewel thefts, and during the investigation Poirot falls in love and finds a criminal intellect which stretches his own little grey cells to the limit. Poirot spends all of his time with the beautiful and clever Countess Rossakoff, leaving Hastings and Miss Lemon to do all the detective work for once.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A crime wave has taken hold of Oxford - a homeless man is grievously assaulted, a young PC is found dead, and a notable artist reported missing. Meanwhile, a debauched group of undergraduates are wreaking havoc.

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Cast Not Your Pearls Before Swine
programme.desc: Thinking hes on to a good deal, Pop Larkin buys two hundred pigs. Before he knows whats what, hes up to his neck in it, and as Mas birthday approaches, Pop arranges a Punch and Judy show and promises to build a swimming pool.

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Cast Not Your Pearls Before Swine
programme.desc: When Primroses new love Roger returns to Liverpool, she is hot on his trail. When they discover that she is safe, Pop and Ma agree to let her stay. Meanwhile, Pops new business acquaintance, George Harran, has mysteriously disappeared.

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: Miss Marple helps a family friend seek refuge at a country pile known as Greenshaws Folly, but a sinister shadow soon begins to fall over the strange old buildings various inhabitants. As Miss Marple uncovers dark, deadly secrets from the past, a dangerous storm is gathering and the threat of murder begins to strike once more.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When a woman is found killed in a remote cottage in the dramatic Northumberland countryside, DI Vera Stanhope is taken back to a place full of childhood memories - and an unsolved case from her own past. She and her team delve into the local politics surrounding a controversial proposal to dig a new quarry, and find motives for murder in the unlikeliest of places, but the truth could be hidden within the land itself.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Doc Martin

programme.title: Vera

programme.title: Teen Mom OG
programme.desc: For four seasons fans of `Teen Mom watched Farrah, Maci, Amber and Catelynn face multiple challenges in their first years of motherhood, including such things as graduating from high school, relationships, getting jobs, beginning college and moving out on their own. Oh, and raising their first child. Now the original girls - hence, the `OG in the revived series title - return to reveal the challenges of raising children on camera, and how life in the public eye has shaped them as parents and people. Its an unprecedented view of young mothers facing the responsibilities of parenthood as their children enter kindergarten, start little league and reach other milestones of youth.

programme.desc: It is bedtime and Peppa calls Kylie Kangaroo and is surprised to learn that it is not morning or winter where she is! Daddy Pig explains this using a big ball to represent the Earth.

programme.desc: While visiting Suzy and Emilys house, Peppa is surprised that there are extra rules which she does not have in her own house. On the drive home, Peppa explains to Mummy Pig that different houses have different rules.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.desc: Peppa and her family go on holiday in a special van. Peppa is surprised to find that at a push of a button the van turns into a little house for them to sleep in.

programme.desc: Peppa and her family go on a day trip to Windy Castle, but Daddy Pig gets grumpy when he loses his way.

programme.desc: Daddy Pig finds it hard work when he runs a race to raise money for the school roof. It is far easier to run when a wasp is chasing him.

programme.desc: Peppa and George get caught in a thunderstorm.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig is taking everyone for a drive in the country, but the car is very muddy and Mummy insists they wash it first.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When the family goes to Granny and Grandpa Pigs house for dinner, George is reluctant to eat his salad.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family go camping, but soon realise that their tent is too small for everyone, so Daddy sleeps underneath the stars.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its bedtime, but Peppa is not sleepy, so Daddy Pig tells Peppa and George a story about a pretty princess and a dinosaur.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig has a surprise for Peppa and George, a beautiful treehouse in his garden.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George have a fancy dress party and all their friends are invited. Peppa dresses as a fairy princess and George as a scary dinosaur.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family visit a museum, and Peppa likes the Kings and Queens room, whereas Georges favourite is the dinosaur room.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George want to jump in muddy puddles, but Mummy tells them to go in the pool.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Chloe has a new puppet theatre and she helps Peppa and George to make puppets. After lunch, they put on a very funny puppet show about a pig who snores a lot, but Daddy Pig and Uncle Pig miss the show, theyre far too busy snoring.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig loves to watch television, but Peppa Pig thinks that he needs to do some exercise. She says that Daddy Pigs tummy is looking a bit big. Daddy Pig disagrees, but says that Peppa can be in charge of getting him fit. Peppa gives him lots of exercises to do and Daddy Pig is exhausted by the end of the day.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George have to tidy their bedroom. After a frenzy of cleaning, the room is tidy, however the room doesnt stay tidy for long though.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are at the playground with their friends. Peppa loves to play on the swings, but George is a bit afraid of heights and doesnt like to be pushed too high.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig has a lovely new picture of Peppa and George, so Daddy Pig offers to put it up, but its not as simple as Daddy Pig thought, and he makes a very big hole in the wall.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George go to the beach and have fun burying Daddy Pig in the sand.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When George finds a spider in the bathroom, Peppa is very frightened until she realises that it doesnt want to hurt her.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny and Grandpa Pig have a beautiful little boat, and Peppa and George are spending the day on the river with them.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig, Daddy Pig, Peppa and George go to the supermarket, and George sits in the trolley while Peppa finds the things on Mummys shopping list.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Peppa Pigs birthday so she awakens very early. First, Peppa gets a present from Mummy, Daddy and George, and then its time for her party. Daddy Pig does some funny magic tricks and makes a birthday cake appear with four candles for Peppa to blow out.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig gets a new movie camera, and everyone laughs when they see Peppa on TV.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas playgroup is putting on a play, and Peppa is going to be Little Red Riding Hood.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her playgroup friends go with Madame Gazelle to visit Pedro Pony, who is poorly in hospital.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbit gives Mummy Pig, Peppa and George a ride in her rescue helicopter. Daddy Pig is very sad to escape all the fun - but Miss Rabbit makes sure that doesnt happen.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Baby Alexander is too young to talk, until Peppa teaches him his first word.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig takes Peppa, George and Danny Dog to visit Grampy Rabbits lighthouse.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Suzy and Peppa start a Secret Club - going on secret missions, and doing secret things, but soon everyone wants to join.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig needs help when his boat sinks, so Granddad Dog gives them all a lift to Grampy Rabbits Boatyard so that the boat can be fixed.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle gives the class a music lesson. Theres lots of crashing and banging at first, but its not long before the grown-ups visit and lay down some notes of their own.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig loses his title as Champion Puddle Jumper, until everyone helps him train to win it back.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George go to play with Cousin Chloe and her friends, but the older children dont want to play any `baby games.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family collect apples and blackberries in Granny and Grandpa Pigs garden to make a pie.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.desc: Peppa and her friends go to help at Edmond Elephants birthday party, but the little children are harder to look after than theyd thought.

programme.desc: Peppa and George wake up one morning to find that all the rain has made a flood, and their house is now a desert island.

programme.desc: Peppa and her family visit a new theme park where there is lots of fun to be had with vegetables.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are taken to visit the home that Mr Bull is building. Will they find out who their new neighbours are going to be?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy teaches the children how to play basketball, and it is not long before they are good enough to take on a much bigger team.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: There is much excitement when Mr Zebra delivers a package from Aunt Dottie for Peppa and George.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Dr Hamsters pet tortoise Tiddles gets stuck up a tree. Who is going to come to the rescue?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George visit Mr Foxs Shop to buy Granny and Grandpa an anniversary present, but what will they choose from the shop that sells everything?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George realise that they have shadows and no matter what they do, they cant escape from them.

programme.desc: The youngsters visit the zoo where they are shown around by zookeepers Mr Lion, Mrs Crocodile and Mr Giraffe.

programme.desc: Peppa and family are watching TV... until it breaks! While Grampy Rabbit fixes it, the family get a new TV which can do everything... but it doesnt beat their old TV.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: A storm cancels Peppa and her familys adventure plans so they decide to take it inside. Using their imagination, they go sledding, climb a mountain and have a campfire in the attic.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are playing in their pool. They help the garden animals cool down but when it rains, the animals are happy and so is Peppa. Rain makes muddy puddles for jumping in!

programme.desc: Peppa and George are in Granny and Grandpa Pigs Garden. Grannys friends are playing folk music! They play music for Grandpa Pig and then Grandpa Pig makes apple juice for everyone!

programme.desc: It is bedtime and Peppa calls Kylie Kangaroo and is surprised to learn that it is not morning or winter where she is! Daddy Pig explains this using a big ball to represent the Earth.

programme.desc: While visiting Suzy and Emilys house, Peppa is surprised that there are extra rules which she does not have in her own house. On the drive home, Peppa explains to Mummy Pig that different houses have different rules.

programme.desc: Mummy Pig is confirming she is having a new baby. Mummy and Daddy Pig share the exciting news with Peppa and her brother, George.

programme.desc: Peppa and George visit Granny Pig, who is very excited about her new pet, a parrot called Polly.

programme.desc: Peppa and George love helping Mummy Pig work on her computer, but they like playing computer games more.

programme.desc: Peppa and George play piggy-in-the-middle while George catches the ball with a little help from Daddy Pig.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George enjoy helping Grandpa Pig plant seeds in his Garden.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.desc: Daddy Pig teaches Peppa to ride her bicycle without stabilisers, just like her friends.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa loves secrets, so Mummy Pig makes her a special box to put secret things in.

programme.desc: Peppa, George and Daddy Pig discover that its not very easy to fly a kite on a windy day.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its a lovely day for a picnic. Peppa and George feed bread to the ducks and Daddy Pig is chased by a wasp.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa plays the drum, Mummy plays the violin, Daddy plays the accordion, but what instrument can George play?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: In Grandpa Pigs garden, Peppa pretends to be a butterfly, Grandpa Pig shows George how to play at being a wriggly worm, and then Peppa, George and Grandpa have fun jumping in muddy puddles.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and all her friends at playgroup dress up as different countries from all over the world.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy teaches Peppa and George a fun game to play while they wait inside for the rain to stop.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Everyone is excited when Mummy Rabbit arrives with a big tummy and they learn that she is carrying a baby bunny inside - but it turns out they are in for an even bigger surprise.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Pedro Pony pretends he is a proper cowboy, telling everyone stories in the camp he has set up in the garden.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig pops round with some seeds for Peppa and George to plant, with Daddy Pig helping out - by acting as a scarecrow.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Doctor Hamster is rushed off her feet when nearly all the animals need her help on the same day.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.desc: Mummy Dog and Danny are very excited! Captain Daddy Dog is home from the sea, and hes bearing gifts! What can they be?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig reads Peppa and George a bedtime story to help them fall asleep. When George wakes up again, Peppa has to make up a bedtime story to get him back to sleep.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family have been on a trip to a mountain beauty spot. When Daddy Pig loses the car keys down a drain, Mr Bull offers to find them with his digger.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George pays a visit to Mr Foxs Shop after his favourite toy, Mr Dinosaur, breaks. With all the additional features, surely Dino Roar is a good replacement?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: Grandpa Pigs Train to the Rescue
programme.desc: Oh dear! Miss Rabbits train has broken down and all her passengers need to get to work. So Grandpa Pig lends Miss Rabbit his little train, Gertrude.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Playgroup is having a pet competition and everyone has brought their pets. Dr Hamster is the judge, but it is so hard to choose the best pet.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Eek! Theres a spider in the house. Mummy Pig tells Daddy Pig to get rid of it. Mr Skinny-Legs is set free in the garden, where he can spin all the webs he likes.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas family is staying at Cousin Chloes house. Its been a long day and everyone is tired and sleepy, but baby Alexander keeps everyone awake with his crying.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny Pig is really pleased with all the plastic gnomes and wishing well shes got for the garden. Peppa and George love them too, but Grandpa Pig wishes they would all disappear.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Oh no! The childrens favourite teacher, Madame Gazelle, is leaving Playgroup. They are very sad to be losing her, but decide to throw a leaving party to give her a good send-off.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbit is to be given the Queens Award for Industry for all the hard work she does, and Peppa and her friends are to accompany her to the palace to meet the Queen.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When a fishing trip goes wrong, leaving Grandpa Pig and Grampy Rabbit stranded on a desert island, Captain Daddy Dog is the only one able to save them. It makes him realise that he misses the sea after all.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: After smelling Granny Pigs perfume de lavender, Peppa experiments with the flowers in the garden to create her own special smell.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa loves the school fete. Her favourite things are face painting, the balloons and the bouncy castle.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Goldie the Goldfish is feeling a little lonely, so Peppa takes her to the aquarium. With all the different fish there, surely Peppa can find a new friend for Goldie?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its a beautiful day but Peppa, George and Grandpa Pig are sitting inside watching the motor racing on the television! Granny Pig shoos them all outside to enjoy the sunshine. Inspired by the racing, Grandpa Pig builds George his own racing car.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George go sailing with Grandpa Pig, but when he keeps getting stuck in the mud, they all decide to have a sleepover on the boat while they wait for the tide to come back in.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle sets the children a creative task - making masks. There are carrot masks, robot masks, and even pretty butterfly masks.The only thing missing is lots and lots of glitter!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: There is a new girl at school, and she quickly makes best friends with Peppa and Rebecca Rabbit. Molly shows them how good she is at digging while taking them on a tour of her underground house.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Richard Rabbits birthday party and George is invited. That can only mean one thing - soft play! George and friends have great fun, swinging, bouncing and climbing, but it isnt quite as much fun for the grown-ups!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family take a trip to the market to buy some apples, cheese and fish. However, they get more than they were expecting when they stop by Mr Foxs stall - he is selling some extra special items!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and the rest of the playgroup put on a big Christmas show for all the Mummies and Daddies. While Danny Dog is dressed up as a Santa, the real Father Christmas pays them a visit!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family travel to Paris to visit Delphine and her relatives. The donkeys take Peppa and her family to the top of the Eifel Tower, forcing Dad to face his fear of heights.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are helping Grandpa Pig to dig a new pond for his garden. While digging, they find hidden treasure so they go to see Mr. Richard in the museum.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family go on a walk through the forest where they meet all of their favourite fairytale characters. They visit the home of bears who like porridge and meet a hungry Mr. Wolf.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and Georges toy basket is full and their beds are covered in toys, so Mummy Pig decides it is time to order a new toy cupboard. The cupboard arrives in the post but it needs to be assembled - and Mummy and Daddy Pig are not very good at DIY. Luckily help is at hand, as Mr Zebra the Postman loves assembling flat pack furniture.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its time for playgroup, and Peppa and friends are thinking about what they want to be when they grow up. Some in the group want to be nurses, police officers and even pirates, but Peppa takes a little while to figure out what she wants to be.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The doctor teaches children what to do when there is an accident. A patient soon appears and they put into practise the new techniques they have learned.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Tiddles gets stuck in a tree and needs to be rescued. When the turtle falls on Pedros nose, he needs to go to the doctors to make sure everything is ok.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The Detective introduces his new friend, the superhero Super Potato who teaches children the importance of eating fruits and vegetables every day, and later helps the Detective out of a complicated situation.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: On a beautiful sunny day, Grandpa takes Peppa and George to spend the day sailing. After an accident, the boat ends up sinking, and now they need rescuing with a hovercraft.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa wins her first star for making a wonderful drawing of her house. Dad realises that he has never won a single star and is determined to solve the problem.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The Carnival has come to town and its a chance to see all sorts of exciting things! There is Mr. Bulls Jazz Band, Miss Rabbit as the Carnival Queen and even a very special appearance from Mr. Potato.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa takes Goldie the Goldfish for a visit to the vets and is surprised when she finds that theres a new road to be built over the building! With the help of Mr. Bull and his brother they find that instead of demolishing the vets they can build a tunnel underneath it.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family have all gone to the caves for a day out and Grampy Rabbit is their tour guide! Peppa and George are excited to see the pretty caves and go through the underground lakes. Daddy Pig must be at his bravest on this trip to go on the scary `Ride of Doom!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa and Granny Pig show and share with Peppa and George their toys and hobbies. Granny her special doll from childhood and Grandpa his love of building toy planes. Peppa and George have great fun when Grandpa reveals his new biggest plane ever that even George can fit in.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George, Peppa and Mummy Pig head off to Miss Rabbits clothes shop to get George some brand new clothes. After trying on lots of new exciting outfits George finds an outfit that suits him just right!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa, George, Mummy and Daddy Pig have gone to visit Madame Gazelle. The family soon realise that her house is being pushed over by the tall tree next to it. Mr. Bull arrives and with his help they all manage to save Madame Gazelles House and tree.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig receives a letter saying he must go away on business to test some very important concrete. Peppa, Mummy and George all decide to go with Daddy and enjoy a train journey, where they sing to pass the time and even have a sleep on the train.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Sheep gets the news that she has got a new job far away, leaving Suzy and Peppa to wonder how theyre going to carry on being best friends; Peppa gives Suzy some presents to remember her by, before a surprising change for Mummy Sheep changes everything.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig is left behind when everyone takes Grampy Rabbits little boat to the riverside picnic spot. Will someone remember him and save him some cake?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends are busy building a desert island in a sandpit. They are all very proud of it, with its forest, lake, houses and shops. Its going splendidly, until George and Richards dinosaurs turn up.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its night time at Grandpa and Granny Pigs house, and Peppa and George have stayed up late to help hunt for slugs and snails, but what other night animals will they find?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The Pig family are preparing to go on holiday. Peppa and George pack their favourite toys and Granny and Grandpa are left to look after Goldie the Fish.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family arrive in Italy and discover that everyone is talking in a different language! Daddy Pig finds driving on the right a little difficult. Its all so very strange, but they are soon settled, and Peppa rings Granny and Grandpa Pig to check that Goldie the fish is happy too.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family are enjoying the first day in their Italian villa. On a trip to the local village, they find pizza to eat, presents to buy and a postcard to send to Goldie the fish.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa has enjoyed her very first holiday abroad, but now its time to go home. Suzy has missed Peppa very much and cant wait to see her. Peppa has missed her friend too and cant wait to see Goldie, her pet fish again.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George enjoys seeing his reflection in the mirror so much that he and Peppa try to find other shiny things to see themselves in.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The playgroup is going on an outing to the museum. Everyone is on the bus ready to go, except Pedro Pony - so where is he?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and Suzy are bored because they have nothing to do, so Daddy Pig finds them an old box of garden games to play with, but not all the games are easy for little George.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Everyone is down at the lake as its a perfect day to go boating. Miss Rabbit has all sorts of boats for hire and Daddy Pig picks one with pedals, but when all the families have a race, he soon wishes he had picked something easier to sail.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: Mr Bull in a China Shop
programme.desc: While enjoying a tea break, Mr Bull accidentally breaks his delicate teapot. He takes the pieces to Miss Rabbit in the hope that she can mend it.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its fruit day at the market and Miss Rabbit is making smoothies from peoples favourite fruit. When she gives George a special `dinosaur juice to make him big and strong.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Whats that strange creature hovering in the sky? Its Georges dinosaur balloon, but little George is finding it difficult to keep hold of his big balloon. Can anyone stop it from flying off to the moon?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends are playing pirates, but when they put together a treasure chest and bury it in a marked spot, Pedro soon realises that he needs to follow the trail. Hes lost something.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas playgroup are really enjoying Grampy Rabbits talk about space rockets, until suddenly he loses his voice. Can Doctor Brown Bear get him speaking again?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When Grandpa Pig puts up a tent in his garden, Peppa and her friends decide that its a perfect place to put on a circus. With Peppa as the ringmaster, the show can begin.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig is looking forward to taking Peppa and George to visit a fish pond that he used to visit when he was a piglet. However, a few things have changed since then.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig shows Peppa and her friend Suzy Sheep some old photographs from when they were babies. Peppa and Suzy dont remember being that young, but they are pleased to see that they have always been best friends.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends are on Snowy Mountain learning how to ski. Their teacher, Madame Gazelle, is very good and was once a world champion, but in the end it is Mummy Pig who impresses everyone.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: PC Panda brings his twin daughters to playgroup Peggi and Pandora Panda. They love puzzles and to solve mysteries just like their dad.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: On a day out with her family, Peppa is encouraged to find words to describe the different kinds of puddles they find.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mandy Mouse joins Peppas playgroup. She uses a wheelchair and is super sporty. The children have a lot of fun playing together.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle teaches the children how to play the recorder. They practise a lot at home, then put on a performance for all the parents to enjoy.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its time for a day out and Peppa, George, Mummy Pig, Daddy Pig and Suzy Sheep all go to visit Tiny Land. They see tiny dinosaurs, their favourite tiny landmarks and even a tiny Miss Rabbit doing even more jobs!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George has fun making bubbles, and Peppa has fun popping them.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle introduces a new pupil to the playgroup, Emily Elephant, and everyone wants to be her friend because shes very good at building blocks and can make a very loud noise with her trunk.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny and Grandpas pet Polly Parrot comes to stay, and Peppa and George love Polly Parrot, but when she flies away, no one knows what to do.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family share a picnic with Mr Zebra the Postman and Zoe Zebra, but when its time to go home, Peppa leaves her teddy behind.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George want to be famous detectives like their favourite television programme `Detective Potato, so daddy pig gives them a mystery to solve.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Rebecca Rabbit has a little brother called Richard who is the same age as George. George and Richard each have a toy dinosaur, but the boys are not very good at sharing their toys.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig is planting seeds to make a flower garden, but the birds keep eating them, so Peppa and George help Grandpa Pig to make a scarecrow, which stops the birds eating Grandpas seeds.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: At the park, all the leaves have turned red and yellow, and its so windy that Peppas ball blows into the pond and Georges hat blows into a tree.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle shows Peppa and her school friends how to make a time capsule, with each of them putting one of their favourite things in the capsule and burying it in the school garden.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George go to the seaside with Granny and Grandpa Pig, and realise not all beaches are sandy. This one has lots of rocks and little rock pools to explore.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George help Mummy Pig tidy up the breakfast things. Mummy Pig teaches them how to recycle the bottles and newspapers, then they take everything to Miss Rabbit at the recycling plant.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family are playing at the pond with their toy boats, but when Peppa and Georges friends arrive, everyone has a boat to play with except Rebecca Rabbit.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas family get caught in a very long traffic jam whilst on the way to have lunch with Granny and Grandpa Pig.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Before bed, Peppa and George take a bath, brush their teeth and listen to Daddy Pig read them a story. Finally, theyre asleep and Mummy Pig and Daddy Pig can relax.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its sports day at Peppas playgroup and lots of special events are due to take place.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas friend Pedro wears glasses, and Peppa thinks she might need them too, so Mummy Pig takes her to the optician.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas car runs out of petrol, but Granddad Dogs garage is nearby, and with one call, Granddad Dog is on his way to help.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy and Daddy Pig take Peppa and George to the playground.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas playgroup is holding a jumble sale to raise money for a new roof and Madame Gazelle asks everyone to bring something to sell. Peppa, and each of her friends, bring in an old toy.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family are at the swimming pool. George is a little worried at first, but is soon splashing happily with his friend Richard Rabbit.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are playing in Grandpa Pigs garden when they find a little snail.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George visit Daddy Pigs office and meet his colleagues. Mr Rabbit works with numbers, while Mrs Cat seems to spend her time drawing shapes on a computer.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa and Granny Pig take Peppa, George and all their friends on a boat trip to Pirate Island. On the island, Grandpa shows everyone how to use his metal detector to find treasure and they all build a big sandcastle.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbit persuades Mummy Pig to go to her relaxation class, but relaxing proves more difficult than expected. However, thanks to Daddy Pigs bouncy castle, they all have fun in the end.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When Daddy Pig is given a parking ticket, Peppa and George learn that adults have rules just like children - and that they get told off too.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: A new synthesiser arrives for Daddy Pig, and his family collect sounds for it from around the house while he is out at work.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: During a picnic in her garden, cousin Chloe shows Peppa and George fun things to do with flowers.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Rebecca and Richard Rabbit are playing a marble run game at Peppas house. But when Daddy Pig joins in and improvises tunnels and bridges, the marble rolls out of the bedroom, causing chaos and nearly knocking Goldie out of her bowl.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When George loses the metal wind-up key for his toy robot in the long grass, Grandpa Pig cannot find his metal detector to help George track it down.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: For World Book Day, the playgroup must dress up as a character from their favourite book. But Peppa cant decide which as she has so many favourites.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa, George, Mummy and Daddy all go on a lovely trip to the childrens festival. There is lots to see and do, including singing, making crafts and listening to stories.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Day two at the festival and it has rained all night. The festival is very muddy and Peppa is thrilled. Luckily, it rains every year and Miss Rabbit is prepared with lots of muddy activities.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: A curious, naive, yet friendly little pig navigates through her life with her friends and family by her side. Guided by her loving mother and brash father, Peppa is stuck almost every day. Her little siblings, however, look up to Peppa lovingly.

programme.desc: Peppa and George join Granny Pig and her friends to play at being Vikings.

programme.desc: Peppa decides that only girls can play in her treehouse, so Grandpa Pig builds the boys their own den.

programme.desc: Zoe Zebra delivers a very special letter for Peppa and George: an invitation to her birthday party.

programme.desc: Daddy Pig winds up the old cuckoo clock in Peppa and Georges bedroom. When the clock strikes the hour, a wooden bird pops out, flapping its wings and singing "Cuckoo!".

programme.desc: Peppa and George go ice skating, but they have never been before, and Peppa keeps falling over.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.desc: When Peppa and George go to the dentist for a check-up, Dr Elephant says their teeth are nice and white, but Georges toy dinosaur is in need of a tooth-clean.

programme.desc: Peppa and George go to Rebecca Rabbits house where, instead of stairs and corridors, there are tunnels.

Luckily help is at hand, as Mr Zebra the Postman loves assembling flat pack furniture.

programme.desc: Mummy Pig is making pancakes, and Daddy Pig flips his so high that it sticks to the ceiling.

programme.title: Angel of Death

programme.title: Murderous Minds: Harold Shipman
programme.desc: Harold Shipman was an English general practitioner and serial killer. He is considered to be one of the most prolific serial killers in modern history, with an estimated 250 victims.

programme.title: Murderous Minds: Rose West
programme.desc: Rosemary Pauline West is an English serial killer who collaborated with her husband, Fred West, in the torture and murder of at least nine young women between 1973 and 1987. She also murdered her eight-year-old stepdaughter, Charmaine, in 1971. Delve into the psychology of Rose to try and understand what turned her into such a cruel rapist and murderer.

programme.title: Aileen: Life and Death of a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This feature-length film examines Aileens harrowing life, tracing her story from the freezing woods of Michigan to the steamy swamps of Florida, and features her closest friends, her lawyers and even her estranged birth mother. At the heart of the film are the astonishing, unique, troubled interviews Broomfield filmed with Wuornos in prison, including her last, defiant words before execution.

programme.title: Great Crimes and Trials

programme.title: Jack the Ripper: Londons Most Notorious Killer

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.desc: Looking at the creation of classic albums goes behind the Doors eponymous debut album. With the use of interviews, musical demonstration, archive footage and live performances, the documentary tells the story behind the conception and recording of the album, and the three surviving members of the Doors share memories of the bands early days, how the album was put together and of Morrison himself.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: George Princey has a high standing in the community. So when his daughter kills a man, George endeavours to cover it up to avoid facing a scandal.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected

programme.title: Garbo: Where Did You Go?
programme.desc: An urgent, timely and compelling portrait of Hollywood icon Greta Garbo, whose fame, isolation and loneliness still captures audiences.

programme.desc: Tongue-in-cheek romp following the spangle-suited Swedish superstars on a hectic tour of Australia as they are pursued by a persistent disc jockey from Sydney. The narrative is punctuated by live footage of the band in concert.

programme.title: Paul Weller: May Love Travel With You
programme.desc: ...Travel With You. New. In a stripped back set at Londons Royal Festival Hall, Paul Weller performs hits from his early career through to tracks from his 2018 solo album True Meanings.

programme.title: Record On
programme.sub-title: Record On: Paul Weller - Wild Wood
programme.desc: Record On: Paul Weller - Wild Wood: The story of Paul Wellers journey through changing times in the 90s, his new direction in sound and the resulting tour de force that is Wild Wood.

programme.title: The Jam: Live at Rockpalast
programme.desc: The Jams live performance from Dortmunds Rockpalast in 1980.

programme.title: The Great Songwriters

programme.title: Discovering Music
programme.desc: A look at the rise of rock opera pioneers The Who, from their formation at school in Acton, London, to their award-winning albums and sell out tours around the world.

programme.title: Discovering Music
programme.desc: Music experts discuss the life and music of Jimi Hendrix, who wowed audiences in the 1960s with his outrageous electric guitar playing skills and his experimental sound.

programme.title: Andre Rieu: Live in Maastricht VI
programme.desc: Renowned violinist Andre Rieu performs live in concert.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.sub-title: I Like It Here in Wilmington
programme.desc: When a clothing manufacturer finds himself on the verge of bankruptcy, he ponders the idea of murdering his wife for the insurance money.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: Steve and Jane are con artists who gain access to peoples homes claiming to be doing research into polish. But eventually, they meet their match.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: Seeking a divorce from his wife, an unhappy husband hires a private eye in the hopes of catching her with another man. But things dont quite go as expected.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: When a married politician falls in love with a woman at a party, things soon go wrong and his entire career and reputation are put in jeopardy.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Hour
programme.desc: The well-to-do wife (Teresa Wright) of a bigamist will go to any lengths to have her husband all to herself.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Hour
programme.desc: A man (Leslie Nielsen) takes his son to a magic shop on his birthday and watches as the store owner makes the boy vanish.

programme.title: Discovering Film
programme.desc: A look at the life of the three-time Academy Award-winner, whose fruitful career includes acclaimed roles in `My Left Foot, Gangs of New York and There Will Be Blood.

programme.title: Discovering Film
programme.desc: A look at the life and career of the two-time Academy Award-winning star of Glory, Training Day, Malcolm X and many more acclaimed films.

programme.title: Guy Garvey: From the Vaults
programme.desc: Head back in time for a visit to 1979, with exclusive interviews and magical performances from Tina Turner, Wings, The Who and more iconic artists.

programme.title: Cream: Live at the Royal Albert Hall
programme.desc: The last appearance of the influential rock band Cream was back in 1968. In May 2005, the legendary band reunited to perform a comeback concert at Londons Royal Albert Hall.

programme.title: Eric Clapton: Across 24 Nights
programme.desc: Eric Claptons legendary 1990 and 1991 Royal Albert Hall performances, edited from the original footage and remastered in Dolby Surround Sound.

programme.title: Nothing Compares
programme.desc: Following the career of celebrated singer Sinead OConnor through her rise to fame and exploring the ways her iconoclastic personality led to exile from the pop mainstream.

programme.title: INXS: Live Baby Live
programme.desc: The group performs "Guns in the Sky," "New Sensation," "Send a Message" and other hits in concert at Wembley Stadium in London.

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.desc: The distinct talents of five musicians produced the fourth best selling album in music history. Their personal tragedies helped craft a timeless piece of pop. This is a behind-the-scenes look at the making of `Rumours.

programme.title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: The emergence of a powerful new villain and the return of an old friend bring Peter Parker to the realization that all his enemies have one thing in common: Oscorp. Based on Marvel Comics characters.

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: Adaptation of the adventures of the swinging comic-strip hero. A shy student becomes a crime fighter after a bite from a mutant spider, during a school outing, gives him extraordinary powers. As he comes to terms with his new-found abilities, he is also forced to contend with a maniac villain known as the Green Goblin.

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: The comic book web-slinger returns for a blockbusting sequel. Crime-fighting has cost Peter Parker his best friend and his true love Mary Jane. However, just as he quits as Spider-Man, New York comes under threat from Dr Octopus, a metal-tentacled madman. Peter has no choice but to swing back into action.

programme.title: Spider-Man 3
programme.desc: Life is sweet for Peter Parker, MJ loves him, her career is taking off and Spidey-mania is sweeping New York. However, when an alien parasite bonds to his suit, its not long before the good times and Spidey turn bad. While his ugly ego is taking centre stage, MJ is dumped from her Broadway show, Harry remembers Spider-Mans role in his fathers death, and Peter is consumed by revenge.

programme.title: The Amazing Spider-Man
programme.desc: Peter Parker finds a clue that might help him understand why his parents disappeared when he was young. His path puts him on a collision course with Dr. Curt Connors, his fathers former partner.

programme.title: The Rugrats Movie
programme.desc: Tommy and his plucky pals go on a forest adventure in his fathers latest invention, the Reptar Wagon.

programme.title: Rugrats Go Wild
programme.desc: The children and their bickering family are stranded on a desert island. Fortunately help is at hand from the Thornberry family, who are visiting the island to film a rare snow leopard. Once again, animal-understanding Eliza saves the day.

programme.title: The Ogglies
programme.desc: Young Max meets the Ogglies, a family of green, garbage-eating creatures who live at the dump in the town of Smelliville. When a contractor plans to build a wellness temple at the dump, Max and his pal must hatch a plan to save the Ogglies home.

programme.title: Home
programme.desc: After an alien race called the Boov take over Earth, a resourceful human girl becomes a banished Boovs ally.

programme.title: Trolls
programme.desc: Poppy, the optimistic leader of the trolls, and Branch, her polar opposite, embark on an adventure that takes them far beyond the only world theyve ever known.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Dracula, who operates a high-end resort away from the human world, goes into overprotective mode when a boy discovers the resort and falls for the counts teen-aged daughter.

programme.title: The Adventures of Tintin: The Secret of the Unicorn
programme.desc: Tintin and his dog Snowy buy a model of a three-masted sailing ship `The Unicorn at a market and are immediately accosted by two people who both want to buy the model from Tintin. Tintin takes the model ship home and is later shot at and then kidnapped on board a ship with Snowy. Will they escape in time, and solve the mystery of the secret of the Unicorn?

programme.title: Monsters vs Aliens
programme.desc: When an evil alien attacks the Earth, a motley crew of monsters is called into action to save the world from imminent destruction. A DreamWorks animation.

programme.title: Happy Feet
programme.desc: Son of Memphis and Norma, little sweet penguin Mumble has a big problem: he cant sing a single note. In a world where everyone needs a heart song to attract a soul mate, Mumble feels he doesnt belong there. Our hero Mumble is the worst singer in the world, but he can tap dance brilliantly.

programme.title: Happy Feet Two
programme.desc: Mumbles son Erik hasnt yet found his talents, and he goes with his friends to Adelie-land which is ruled by a penguin who can fly. When Erik returns to Emperor-land and finds them trapped under big walls of ice. Will Erik be able to save his family and friends before it is too late?

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Dracula, who operates a high-end resort away from the human world, goes into overprotective mode when a boy discovers the resort and falls for the counts teen-aged daughter.

programme.title: The Ogglies

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: Otis the cow is a wild-living party animal and just loves to dance until dawn, but then his dad is killed by coyotes, and Otis has to become the responsible leader of the rest of the all-singing, all-dancing farm animals.

programme.title: The Amazing Maurice
programme.desc: Maurice is a streetwise ginger cat who comes up with a money-making scam by befriending a group of self-taught talking rats. When Maurice and the rodents meet a bookworm called Malicia, their little con soon goes down the drain.

programme.title: Teen Titans GO! to the Movies
programme.desc: With a few madcap ideas and a song in their hearts, the Teen Titans head to Hollywood to fulfill their dreams. Things soon go awry, however, when a supervillain plans to take over the planet, putting the very fate of the young heroes on the line.

programme.title: The Nut Job
programme.desc: After he accidentally destroys the winter food supply of his fellow Liberty Park residents, Surly, a squirrel, is banished to the streets of Oakton. Luckily, Surly finds the towns nut shop and hatches a plan to plunder its bounty. However, unbeknown to Surly and his ragtag team of animal associates, the nut shop is really a front for mobsters who plan to rob the bank next door. While Surly and his team break in to the shop, the mobsters carry out their own scheme.

programme.title: The Nut Job

Luckily, Surly finds the towns nut shop and hatches a plan to plunder its bounty.
